npc.1: I'm looking forward to working with you.
npc.3: Thank you for your hard work.
npc.303: So, which piece of equipment do you want to improve?
npc.304: Right now you can improve these pieces of equipment.
npc.308: Looks good! The Improvement is successful!
npc.309: I'm sorry... I couldn't improve it...
npc.310: An upgrade to a better equipment is now possible!
npc.312: Welcome, how may I help you?
npc.313: So it's gonna be this one!
npc.314: Are you sure you want this?
npc.317: Thank you for your continued custom, admiral!
npc.318: Please try out Large Ship Construction when you have enough resources and materials to spare!
npc.402: Admiral, Our operation has succeeded as expected.
npc.408: Admiral, It is your time to next mission.

titlecall_b.07: Listen well? Carve victory into the dawn horizons!
titlecall_b.08: Let's go! Carve victory into the dawn horizons!
titlecall_b.09: Listen well? Carve victory into the dawn horizons!
titlecall_b.10: Listen well? Carve victory into the dawn horizons!

titlecall_c.02: We will be under your care~
titlecall_c.03: We will be under your care~
titlecall_c.04: We will be under your care~
titlecall_c.05: We will be under your care~

80.1: I am Battleship Nagato, pleased to meet you. Leave the enemy battleships to me.
80.25: Born as the first battleship of the 8-8 fleet programme, the nameship of the Nagato-class battleships, Nagato. Until Yamato was commissioned, I served as the flagship of the Combined Fleet. I was called one of the 'Big 7'.
80.3: Is there something on my face?
80.4: I would prefer that you don't touch my equipment quite so much.
80.29: Hm? What? It's not like I have much time on my hands. Ah yes, I am so busy...
80.28: It's alright.... I'm here with you.
80.24: What is it I wonder? What is that landscape, deep inside my memories? Friendly and enemy ships, and then that intense light... Hey, Admiral...I must be stressed out.
80.9: My thanks. Now I can fight with them.
80.10: Modernization? I don't require such things though...
80.27: My thanks. Now I can fight them.
80.12: I'd prefer to enter the decisive battle in perfect condition.
80.6: The repaired ship, can now return to the line of battle.
80.5: It seems our new comrade has been launched. I'm looking forward to seeing her.
80.7: Mission complete. The fleet has returned.
80.15: Don't underestimate the power of the Big Seven.
80.16: The long-awaited decisive battle, huh. I'm getting all excited.
80.18: Alright! Fleet, I, Nagato, shall lead the way!
80.17: All main cannons, full salvo! Fiiiiire!
80.23: It is insignificant compared to the honour of being the combined fleet's flagship, but... I'll accept it.
80.20: The Nagato-class' armour is not just for show.
80.21: Damn...The enemy fleet is pretty good...
80.22: To sink in battle... not in that flash... is what I yearned for...

50.1: I'm Destroyer Shimakaze. When it comes to speed I'm the best there is, swift like the island breeze!
50.25: I am Shimakaze, the Shimakaze-class ship that was developed as the pinnacle of destroyers, fast and armed with heavy torpedos. After all, I can go faster than 40 knots. However, we were not suited for mass production so I was the only one built.
50.4: Want to race? I won't lose.
50.29: Hmm… Ah! I'm just talking with Rensouhou-chan now… sigh…'cause I'm bored!
50.28: Eh? Admiral, you're tired from running? How slo~w!... But, do your best!
50.24: Admiral, did you watch me running? Heh, it's fast, yeah? Yeah? *smug*
50.8: Seems like there are messages addressed to you, Admiral.
50.9: Can I keep getting faster and faster?
50.10: Don't blame me if I get even faster!
50.27: Can I keep getting faster and faster?
50.11: I want my engines serviced too!
50.12: Rensouhou-chan needs to be fixed, too.
50.6: Looks like a ship is completely repaired.
50.5: It looks like another ship slower than me has been constructed.
50.7: The fleet finally came back. Slow, huh?
50.15: There's nobody that can keep up with me, you know!
50.18: I told you there's no escape from Shimakaze!
50.23: I'm the best? Really? I knew it! I'm fast, after all!
50.21: Argh, for me to get hit...
50.22: I guess being fast isn't all...

107.1: The girl that became an aircraft carrier, Chiyoda. Of course, I'll be assigned to Chitose-onee's fleet, yes?
107.25: Heavily remodeled from a seaplane tender, I'm the job-changed aircraft carrier Chiyoda. I'm quite the carrier, no? I'll fight the enemy air force together with Chitose-onee!
107.4: Chitose-onee, do that when we're alone in the room... Oh. It's you, Admiral?
107.29: Admiral, it's Chiyoda! Did you forget about me?
107.28: Even though I'm worried for just Chitose-onee, the Admiral upon that... really, good grief.
107.24: Admiral.... I'm happy that you have feeling for me, but still, I'm worried about Chitose-onee...
107.9: Thank you! With this, I can match the regular carriers, no?
107.10: Leyte will be okay this time!
107.11: Carrier maintenance is vital, you know.
107.12: Ow-w-w~ Keep this a secret... from Chitose-nee~
107.5: A new ship has been added to our fleet.
107.7: Operation's complete, the fleet has returned.
107.14: Aircraft carrier Chiyoda, launching! Attack wings are all ready, sortieing!
107.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Strike wing, commencing assault!
107.16: Right, bomber wing, attack wing, It's your turn!
107.18: It's about time for the coup-de-grace!
107.23: Yay! I can really do it with as an aircraft carrier, can't I? Chitose-nee, did you see me?
107.20: The flight deck's on fire!? Put it out!
107.21: Oooh... Well, I'm a light carrier... I can't be too reckless.
107.30: I'm Chiyoda. I'll be acting as your timekeeper today. Ah, it's midnight.
107.31: 1 A.M. Admiral, your're going to keep going at this time? You should sleep soon.... I want to go to Chitose-onee's....
107.32: 2 A.M. Not sleeping? I wanna hurry up and go to Chitose-onee's room so go to sleep~
107.33: 3 A.M. To call on the Admiral hourly... seriously, what kind of mission is this?
107.34: 4 A.M.... I-I can't sleep now! I'm in the middle of a mission!
107.35: 5 A.M. Admiral, It's morning. This mission, will Chitose-onee have to do it... if I don't?
107.36: 6 A.M. About time for the town to wake up.
107.37: 7 A.M. Admiral, it's morning! Are you refreshed?
107.38: 8 A.M. You look busy. Job? Study? Manuscript? Anything's fine. Going off to sortie!
107.39: 9 A.M. I wonder what's Chitose-onee's doing around this time...
107.40: 10 A.M. Admiral, what do you think of Chitose-nee? You're gonna answer me in an hour!
107.41: 11 A.M. Sooooo, you like Onee, huh? E-eh!? N-No, you can't!
107.42: Midday.... hey, Admiral, until you take back what you said, today's lunch is on hold!
107.43: It's 1 P.M. Admiral, take it back! I'm getting hungry too~ hey~
107.44: 2 P.M. The Admiral's so stubborn~ You'll be my rival in love from today! Eh, it can't be helped. Here, onigiri.
107.45: It's 3 P.M. So, where are we attacking this afternoon? East? South?
107.46: 4 P.M. Not here... Chitose-nee's not here!
107.47: 5 P.M. Admiral~ What do you like about Sis? You're gonna answer me in an hour!
107.48: 6 P.M. So, what's your answer!　hmm... I see... hmmm... e-eh! N-No way!
107.49: 7 P.M. It's dinner time but.... Admiral... you go on ahead... I'm a little shocked... I lost my appetite...
107.50: It's 8 P.M. My eyes aren't red...because I've been crying!
107.51: It's 9 P.M. Admiral... giving me supper... I'm a little glad, maybe...
107.52: It's 10 P.M. As I thought, Chitose-Onee sleeping on the Admiral's lap, I can't forgive this!
107.53: 11 P.M! I'll refresh the memories of Onee! So, gimme that lap! Good night!

73.1: We meet again, Admiral. It's Mogami. How's my flight deck? Does it suit me?
73.25: First of the Mogami-class heavy cruisers. By taking off my stern cannons and replacing them with an aviation deck, the Aviation Cruiser was developed! Equal fire and air power, howzat!
73.2: Admiral, have you got something for me to do?
73.3: You interested in my flight deck?
73.4: Yeaaah, well, I am different from the regular carriers. If you use me well, I think it'll be interesting, you know?
73.29: Admiral! Oh, you're busy? I'm going out for some workout.
73.28: I'm always crashing because I've only got eyes for you, Admiral! Just kidding!
73.24: Admiral, wassup? What's with that look? Is there something up with my flight deck?
73.8: Looks like there's a notice for the Admiral
73.9: Ooh, you're gonna make me even stronger?
73.10: So you use it like this... huh~
73.11: Going in for repairs. Why do I keep running into friends...? This sucks...
73.12: Aaah... my long-awaited flight deck came to nothing, damnit...
73.6: An ally has return from the dock.
73.7: The operation is over, the fleet has come back
73.17: Gathering the rains of summer, how swift it is... Basho, right?
73.23: This is my true power, dude. 'cause I'm something like the pioneer of the helicopter destroyers, you know?
73.21: Damnit! A direct hit... that's no joke...
73.22: Ugh...I wonder if I can apologize to Mikuma in the other world...
73.32: 0200. Say, I didn't know I have to do night shifts.
73.33: 0300. *yawn* Eh? You're still working in this late time? Thank you for your work!
73.34: 0400. *big yawn* Man, Admiral sure works hard.
73.35: 0500. Huh? Ah, I was dreaming a bit just now.
73.36: 0600. What was my dream about? That's a secret!
73.37: 0700. Is it OK if i sleep now?
73.38: 0800. Oh, come on. Your office has a futon, right?
73.39: 0900. Ehh? You've packed the futon? Well, the kotatsu is fine too.
73.40: 1000. Your eyes are wide open when you're bustling.
73.42: 1200. Admiral, let's fill up at lunch, okay?
73.43: 1300. I'm stuffed! Dessert goes in a different stomach, though.
73.44: 1400. Mmm, Mamiya's ice cream is delicious! Admiral, you got cream on your face... Yep, there you go!
73.45: 1500. If the meal comes with dessert, I guess I can do the night shift.
73.46: 1600. I managed to eat a lot, but I'm sleepy now.
73.47: 1700. I'm so tired, I feel like I can sleep while walking...Oh, sorry!
73.48: 1800. This... This is the Admirals office!? Why!?
73.49: 1900. The Admiral carried me here!? I'm really sorry!
73.50: 2000. Wah! I'm supposed to make curry for dinner tonight!... Hm... this smell....
73.51: 2100. Admiral, As a backup, Kumarinko brought some curry she made. Well, let's dig in!
73.52: 2200. Eating curry together with the Admiral makes it delicious. I could eat it every day!
73.53: 2300. So, Admiral, we're finished with everything, right?

82.1: I'm the aviation battleship 'Ise'! With a rear-facing flight deck and 2 catapults, I can make use of the power of aviation!
82.25: To obtain the power of marine aviation, a main cannon was removed, and in it's place a flight deck was installed, granting the aviation power of a light aircraft carrier. Aviation battleship, Ise. My name was taken up by the newly-developed DDH of the Marine Self Defence Force.
82.2: Well, seaplanes are just the standard, you know.
82.3: Ah, sorry. Did you call me?
82.4: The firepower of a battleship with the flight power of a light aircraft carrier... yeah, it's pretty awesome, isn't it?
82.24: Admiral, erm... could you please not take my catapult away... If I don't have that, I'll... Ah! You meanie!
82.8: Letter for the Admiral.. you are probably busy, yeah?
82.9: Aren't they just perfect, these things!
82.10: Hehe, Hyuuga's in for a surprise, isn't she?
82.27: Hehe, Hyuuga's in for a surprise, isn't she?
82.11: It's just a scratch. But thanks anyway.
82.12: As expected, it looks like I need some repairs.
82.6: Admiral, seem like repairs are finished.
82.5: Admiral, looks like a new ship type has been launched.
82.7: The armada has returned. Good work!
82.14: You're late, Hyuuga. I'm leaving you behind!
82.16: Zuiuns and the like, how are they? Are they cool?
82.17: Main cannon, 4 rounds 8 shots, broadside fire!
82.23: Eh, I've still got the number one result? How about that Hyuuga, you're being a bit quiet.
82.19: Compared to the Ozawa Decoy Fleet, this is nothing!
82.20: Hit me with your best shot!
82.22: Well, I guess I did what I could...Hyuuga, take your time to come...

108.1: I'm the girl who took a diet and became an aircraft carrier, Chitose. I even got faster. Maybe I should write a book about it.
108.25: Renovated from a seaplane carrier to a carrier, I'm Chitose. Slimming down my body by dieting. My legs even became faster. This will let me play a part in the Task Force! I'll do my best for you!
108.3: Isn't it great, this flightdeck? It's my favorite.
108.4: Admiral, I don't recall saying it was okay to touch.
108.29: There is no fleet action scheduled for a while. Before the next operation, I'm going to deal with many of trivial things that may bother you in the future. Admiral, drink sake if you like, and please make yourself at home. (Kai Ni)
108.28: The Admiral is always doing his utmost best. It's okay. I understand.
108.24: Thank you for always looking out for the reborn Chitose, Admiral.
108.9: I wonder if Chiyoda has gotten stronger.
108.10: No way, I might actually be cool.
108.12: Man, that's gonna leave a mark... Chiyoda will worry, so let's keep it a secret, yeah?
108.6: Repairs are over, the cans are over there. (Kai Ni)
108.5: A new ship has been completed.
108.7: The fleet has returned to the home port.
108.16: Fellow planes, go get 'em! /or/ First attack wave, take off!
108.23: Chiyoda's gonna yell "Don't get too cocky" at me, so let's keep quiet about this.
108.20: I won't let you hit my flight deck!
108.21: Ah man, my precious flight deck...
108.22: Chiyoda... I leave the rest... to you...
108.30: 12 midnight. Together with the Admiral, I watched the day tick over! *giggle*
108.31: It's 1 A.M. Ah, somehow I'm uneasy... perhaps Chiyoda is mad?
108.32: It's 2 A.M. Being the timekeeper, it's a bit rough, you know...
108.33: It's 3 A.M. Just as a nightcap, would you like something to drink?
108.34: 4 A.M. I wonder if Chiyoda is sleeping well...
108.35: 5 A.M. Admiral, the daily quests have renewed. Let's clear them out together!
108.36: zzz... haa... Ah! 6 A.M. Admiral! Sorry! I borrowed your lap for a bit.
108.37: 7 A.M. Daybreak sure is refreshing. Good morning.
108.38: It's 8 A.M. Thanks to the Admiral, I was able to sleep well last night.
108.39: 9 A.M. For me, it's too early to be drinking or to be sober. *giggle*
108.40: 10 A.M. Today's maneuvers, what are you considering?
108.41: 11 A.M. For lunch, what do you want to do?
108.42: 12 midday, it's lunch time, no? On a hill overlooking the port, even a bento is great!
108.43: It's 1 P.M. With the Admiral, even a convenience bento is great. *giggle* How lovely!
108.44: It's 2 P.M. Ah.. Admiral, I see Chiyoda over there! He~y Chiyoda~?
108.45: It's 3 P.M. Oh my? Chiyoda, she ran away all angry. I wonder why~?
108.46: It's 4 P.M. Admiral, this evening's maneuvers, what are you considering?
108.47: 5 P.M. Such a beautiful twilight, isn't it?
108.49: 7 P.M. Just time for dinner, no? How about we go to Houshou's?
108.50: 8 P.M. Admiral, how about taking your time in a bath today?
108.51: 9 P.M. Admiral, the bath is.... going together is impossible!
108.52: 10 P.M. Oh my, what is it Chiyoda? It's all right, I'm not bothering the Admiral. Don't worry.
108.53: 11 P.M. Admiral, staying up late every day is bad. Go to bed early today...

109.4: Chitose-onee, do that when we're alone in the room... Oh. It's you, Admiral?
109.29: Admiral, it's Chiyoda! Did you forget about me?
109.28: Even though I'm worried for just Chitose-onee, the Admiral upon that... really, good grief.
109.24: Admiral.... I'm happy that you have feeling for me, but still, I'm worried about Chitose-onee...
109.9: Thank you! With this, I can match the regular carriers, no?
109.10: Leyte will be okay this time!
109.11: Carrier maintenance is vital, you know.
109.12: Ow-w-w~ Keep this a secret... from Chitose-nee~

109.16: Right, bomber wing, attack wing, It's your turn!
109.18: It's about time for the coup-de-grace!
109.23: Yay! I can really do it with as an aircraft carrier, can't I? Chitose-nee, did you see me?
109.20: The flight deck's on fire!? Put it out!
109.21: Oooh... Well, I'm a light carrier... I can't be too reckless.

109.31: 1 A.M. Admiral, your're going to keep going at this time? You should sleep soon.... I want to go to Chitose-onee's....

109.34: 4 A.M.... I-I can't sleep now! I'm in the middle of a mission!

109.36: 6 A.M. About time for the town to wake up.

109.38: 8 A.M. You look busy. Job? Study? Manuscript? Anything's fine. Going off to sortie!
109.39: 9 A.M. I wonder what's Chitose-onee's doing around this time...
109.40: 10 A.M. Admiral, what do you think of Chitose-nee? You're gonna answer me in an hour!

109.42: Midday.... hey, Admiral, until you take back what you said, today's lunch is on hold!
109.43: It's 1 P.M. Admiral, take it back! I'm getting hungry too~ hey~
109.44: 2 P.M. The Admiral's so stubborn~ You'll be my rival in love from today! Eh, it can't be helped. Here, onigiri.
109.45: It's 3 P.M. So, where are we attacking this afternoon? East? South?
109.46: 4 P.M. Not here... Chitose-nee's not here!
109.47: 5 P.M. Admiral~ What do you like about Sis? You're gonna answer me in an hour!
109.48: 6 P.M. So, what's your answer!　hmm... I see... hmmm... e-eh! N-No way!
109.49: 7 P.M. It's dinner time but.... Admiral... you go on ahead... I'm a little shocked... I lost my appetite...
109.50: It's 8 P.M. My eyes aren't red...because I've been crying!
109.51: It's 9 P.M. Admiral... giving me supper... I'm a little glad, maybe...
109.52: It's 10 P.M. As I thought, Chitose-Onee sleeping on the Admiral's lap, I can't forgive this!
109.53: 11 P.M! I'll refresh the memories of Onee! So, gimme that lap! Good night!

110.1: I'm Shoukaku, the first of the Shoukaku-class carriers. I will try my best with Zuikaku to try and live up to the names of my seniors in the first and second aviation divisions.
110.25: I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series. I was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines. I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series. I was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines. And now, having gotten over Mariana, I wish to continue taking a leap forward with the Admiral.
110.2: Geez, Zuikaku, stop fiddling with my skirt so mu- huh, oh my, Admiral?
110.3: Zuikaku, don't bother the admiral so much, okay?
110.29: Admiral? Um... We should head to Port Moresby... Um, uh...
110.28: Admiral, I'm always really grateful for you hard work. Please take a short break, okay.
110.24: Thank you, Admiral. Giving me these planes that I've never seen before, my gratitude is overflowing. Maybe… just maybe… if my wish comes true, after the Marianas, we can stay together…
110.8: Admiral, would you like to browse through the report?
110.9: Thank you! I can use these!
110.10: I'm so happy! Many thanks, admiral.
110.11: I'll take a short bath... be out in a bit.
110.12: I seem to get injured rather easily... is this so, Zuikaku?
110.6: Admiral, ship in the dock was fully repaired.
110.5: Admiral, a new ship has been completed.
110.7: The fleet has returned! Thank you all for the hard work.
110.14: You ready, Zuikaku? Let's go. Mobile squad, deploying!
110.16: Here I go. All planes, attack!
110.18: Now... what's going to appear? Make sure you watch out for submarines.
110.23: I did it, Admiral! It's all thanks to the planes and supporting ships! Thank you all!
110.19: O-ouch... I can still do this!
110.20: Geez, why is it always me?
110.21: I've been hit! It's difficult to launch and land ship-borne planes!
110.22: Looks like... I'm gone again... Yahagi, Akizuki... please take care of things now.
110.30: Admiral? Seems like the date has changed.
110.35: It's now 0500. The sun's about to come up, huh.
110.36: 0600. It's about wake-up time for everyone.
110.37: 0700. What would you like for breakfast?
110.38: 0800. I'll do my best today too.
110.39: It's now 0900. Should I send out scout planes?
110.40: It's 1000. I wonder if Zuikaku is okay?
110.41: 1100. I guess we should prepare for lunch.
110.42: Admiral, it's 1200. Shall we have lunch?
110.44: It's 1400. Admiral, are you feeling tired?
110.45: It's 1500. The campaign is about to begin.
110.46: 1600. I'll be sending up the CAP.
110.47: It's 1700. Isn't the sunset beautiful, Admiral?
110.50: 2000. There are some noisy light cruisers. I wonder why?
110.53: It's now 2300. You really should be resting now shouldn't you?

111.1: Second of the Shoukaku-class aircraft carriers, the younger sister Zuikaku. The lucky carrier, you say? That's not it, I just fight with all my might... As long as I have planes, I won't lose! It's me, Zuikaku, with a full modernization on all of my carrier rigging. Be advised that this is not your ordinary standard carrier. (Kai-2)
111.25: Second of the Shoukaku-class aircraft carriers, Zuikaku. After Midway, I formed the core of the 1st carrier division with Shoukaku, where I fought until I had nothing left. Quite literally, until the day that the Kidou-butai was destroyed... Second of the Shoukaku-class aircraft carriers, Zuikaku. After Midway, I formed the core of the 1st carrier division with Shoukaku, where I fought until I had nothing left. Quite literally, until the day that the Kidou-butai was destroyed. But, this time is different. I will show you the strength of fully renovated aircraft carrier. Shoukaku-nee, let's do this! (Kai-2)
111.2: Admiral, what is it? A battle?
111.3: Shoukaku, what is it? Oh, the Admiral! What is it!? Do you want to get bombed!?
111.4: All planes, prepare for immediate takeoff! Objective, the home port office's Admiral! Go get 'em!
111.29: Admiraaal, Somehow, I'm getting bored of this... I'm gonna go and sulk...
111.28: Admiral, it's bad to work too hard, you know...?
111.24: Admiral, what's up - with such a serious look? Is there something on my face? Eh? Ah! Too close, you're too close! Your face! Ah.. Aaa…aaa…
111.8: Admiral, how is it? How's it going?
111.9: Yeah, looks good! Thanks! New planes? Yeah, looks good! Thanks (Kai2)
111.10: Man, this is good stuff... thanks! New model airplane. Hmm... Sounds good to me. It's definitely compatible to my current rigging. (Kai-2)
111.27: Fuel, ammo... planes are all fueled up and ready to go.
111.11: I'm going to the bath for a bit.
111.12: Well... Even I get hurt sometimes, huh...
111.6: Admiral, The bath seems to be empty. I want to jump in!
111.5: Admiral, it seems there's a new ship.
111.7: The fleet has returned safely. Whew... thank goodness.
111.14: Aircraft carrier Zuikaku, setting sail. Mobile Fleet Flagship Zuikaku, set sail! Follow my lead! (Kai-2)
111.15: 1st attack squadron, begin launch! Shoukaku, let do this. Fore's on windward! Attack squadron, sally go! (Kai-2)
111.16: We'll decide this... from outside their range! Now, let's get started. This time we'll definitely strike from outer range. All strike wings, take off!

118.29: Will Kitakami-san be alright?..... I'm getting worried as I'm not with her... Hmm... I'm so worried... It's definitely, yes, there's definitely something that's about to happen! I have to go now!
118.28: Admiral? What happened to the other girls, you say? Eh...? That's not it? Hmm, it's okay then.. It's okay...
118.24: Of the two Torpedo cruisers, you chose me, right?... If you betray me, I'll sink you in the ocean, you know...
118.9: These Type-93 Oxygen Torpedoes are so cool... and marvelous.
118.10: Hehehe... Nobody will get in our way anymore... Ah, there's a speck of dust on my shoulder. OK, I'm good.
118.27: Yep, be sure to pack me with fuel and torpedoes okay? Fufu, this way I can fight again.
118.11: Yes, I'll be taking a short break.
118.12: It's all the campaign's fault! No, sorry for my incompetence.
118.6: That's right, a ship is fully repaired.
118.5: Eh? A new ship? ...Tch, another nuisance. No, it's nothing.
118.7: The campaign has ended. Good work.
118.14: Now, I will strike with the true power of these wonderfully cold oxygen torpedoes!
118.15: I get all worked up when I hear about exchanging shells!
118.16: Become scrap at the bottom of the sea!
118.18: Who's the one that hurt Kitakami?
118.23: I'm the one? Aww, I'm loss for words♪ Eh, Kitakami-san...? Did Kitakami-san see that!? Did she!?
118.21: Oh no! My torpedo tubes are in tatters now!
118.22: I guess it isn't bad... to sink as a Torpedo Cruiser...
118.30: Admiral, midnight has just came around again. It's late night.
118.31: The time is currently at 0100. Eh...? It sounds too strict? I-I see...
118.32: The time is――... Ah, I mean, it's 0200. Do you prefer it like this, Admiral?
118.33: 0300. ...Geez, so annoying. Being picky even in the way I make the hourly announcements... N-Nothing! It's 0300, sir!
118.34: It's 04...00... Admiral? Admiral...? Did he go to sleep? ...THIS IS MY CHANCE!
118.35: 0500. I need to go to Kitakami-san's side!! Yes, she is definitely troubled! Kitakami-saaaaaaaaaan!!
118.36: 0600! Kitakami-san, are you okay, are you safe!? I-it looks like you're fine... Eh? This knife? Ah, it's for making breakfast...
118.37: 07,00... Yes, I was thinking, of preparing, breakfast... For today's miso soup, are you okay with gluten?
118.38: 0800. Alright, for Kitakami-san's sake, I made breakfast with a quality that is above my skill level! Please go ahead and eat up♪ ...It's delicious? I'm relieved♪
118.39: 0900. Eh, shouldn't I return to my post? But...
118.40: 1000. Admiral, I'm back... Where did I go? ...Isn't it obvious, of course it's to Kitakami-san's place!!
118.41: 1100. Um... Admiral? Why are you holding your head like that? Did you get a flu!? Let's see, where is the flu medicine...
118.42: It's 1200. It is now noon. Should I make some lunch? It's fine. I'm good at cooking.
118.43: 1300. Go on, eat up! Eh? What is this...? It's obviously omelette rice! Should I write something with the ketchup?
118.44: It's 1400. What is it, Admiral? What's with that look of doubt on your face. I didn't do anything like poison your lunch, you know? How rude.
118.45: 1500. It's about time to seriously go out for some sorties now I guess. ..Yes, I'll do my best!
118.46: 1600. Um... For the expedition, what should the fleet do, Admiral?
118.47: It's 1700. Oh my, It's nearly dinner time. I'll prepare dinner food for a while.
118.48: The time is currently at 1800. What kind of pot is this, you ask? It's certainly, my special curry, fulfilled with my love! I'm leaving!
118.49: 1900. Kitakami-san♪ I just accidentally cook too much curry! If you don't mind, let's eat togetheeeeR!
118.50: 2000. See, there's a curry for Admiral too. Eh? It's delicious...? Your body is getting hotter? You see?
118.51: It is now 2100. Let's see, we're done washing up, the area around the fire is okay too. Good work for today, Admiral. Fuu...
118.52: 2200. Tsk, That one light cruiser is making such a noise A―GAIN... Admiral, Can I go to complain her? Ah, O...Okay?
118.53: 2300. Admiral, Thank you for your hard work today. Is Kitakami-san already sleeping?

119.1: A brand new Kitakami... that's me, all right. I feel a lot more grown up, loaded to the brim with oxygen torpedoes.
119.25: It's Super Kitakami-sama, equipped with type-93 oxygenated torpedos, with 20 firing tubes on each side. It's been said that I have overpowering strength, but I did not really get any chances to shine. Bah.
119.2: These Type-93 oxygen torpedoes sure are heavy...
119.3: Nuh... What, Admiral...? What is it with you? I don't mind it, though.
119.4: Oh, geez, Ooi, stop touching me- hey, 'tis the Admiral. Da heck ya' doing?
119.29: You know... My shoulder is getting all stiff. Even though I'm still too young for this~. Torpedoes really are kinda heavy, aren't they?
119.28: Admiral? What's up? Feeling down? That's not like you, it's all good.
119.24: Well, what to say? Right...ain't that a good feeling? Lately...I kinda think that but, yeah... well, that's kinda how it is?
119.8: Oh, that's right. Gotta confirm the news.
119.9: Oh, keep em' coming! I'll become an even better ship♪
119.10: Oh yes, I'm getting the chills! Thank you, really♪
119.11: Yeah... 'tis a difficult ship, ain't it.
119.12: Well, a bath is good too right~? Right, Ooichi?
119.6: Repair is done. How bout you take a look.
119.5: A new ship has been floated, yup.
119.7: Oh, seems like the fleet returned.
119.14: Well, I make the ultimate combination with Ooi.
119.15: I guess these single turrets just have a sense of elegance.
119.16: My 40 firing tubes aren't just for show, I say.
119.18: Time to make oil soup out of you!
119.17: Well, my main cannons are... well... yeah...
119.23: Hehe, so this is the power of a torpedo ship. Man... I'm glad I got to do something.
119.19: Guh... I really have no defensive powers...
119.21: Well, how should I say this... I guess these things happen. I wanna get fixed!
119.22: I'd like to be a Aircraft Carrier in my next life please...Repair Ship is not bad too～ ahaha
119.31: 0100. Yes, that's right. It's the time keeping thing. I'll be doing it for today.
119.32: 0200. I'm gettin' bored of it-. Don't you have things like manga? No manga? ...tch.
119.33: 0300. It's completely late into the night now. I'm sleepy too...
119.34: It's now 0400. Aren't you sleepy, Admiral? I see, isn't that nice...
119.35: 0500. It turned into morning now... It's so bright-... I'm sho sleepy, can I sleep? Starting from right now...
119.36: 0600. Wah! What's wrong, Ooichi? Why're you makin' such a scary face? What's wrong? What's up?
119.37: 0700. Admiral, Ooichi made breakfast. Eh? It's fine, I'm thankful for it.
119.38: 0800. The breakfast that Ooichi made, time to eat! ...Hmm, why is there only portions for two? What about Admiral's?
119.39: 0900. So I keep saying, I'm fine, Ooichi. Go on, go back to your post~. Yes, yes.
119.40: 1000. Fuu... Ooichi has finally gone back. No, she's a good girl, really. Ah, you already knew that? Is that so.
119.41: 1100. After doin' the things on hand, it's already noon huh. Hmm, what should I eat for lunch? Ah, there's still work to do? Right right.
119.42: 1200. It's lunch tiime-! So, what should I eat today? Hmm.
119.43: 1300. That's right, as expected, it's got to be curry for lunch~! Should I go for Mamiya curry? Or should I just take a rest?
119.44: Fuu, in the end, it's always Mamiya-san's curry. Well, that's fine too. It's delicious after all. Ah, it's 1400. Just for the record.
119.45: 1500. Well. Lot'sa things happened. But y'know, that also can't be helped. Is what I'm thinking now.
119.46: 1600. Ah, it's Abukuma. O~i! Hmm? Why did she run away? O~i. ...What a weird person, right?
119.47: It's now 1700. Almost time to finish for the day~ The sun's heading down~
119.48: 1800. Well, 'bout time we close up, yeah? Oh, still too early? I see... tch.
119.49: 1900. Ah, Ooichiii! Why'ya holding a pot? Eh? Ooichi's deluxe curry? C-Curry is it...
119.50: 2000. Hey, Admiral, it is okay to have curry again for dinner? Hmmm. It's pretty good, I'm gettin' chills! Ooicchi, thanks♪
119.51: 2100. Well, we ended up having nothing but curry today, but Ooichi's sure is delicious, yeah? The flavor's a bit strange, though.
119.52: 2200. Well, it's about time for the fleet missions to end for today, yeah? Good work everyone~. Time to sleep, time to sleep. Bye Admiral.
119.53: 2300. ...mm? Mmm~? Ehh.. I'm on night duty today? Eh~? Can I pull it off, doesn't it seem kinda impossible?

120.1: Admiral, I've attained a new form!
120.25: I get along very well with Mogamin, the first ship in the Mogami class, but we get along too well sometimes and collide often... Yeah... literally... I do watch where I'm going, okay?
120.2: I will be troubled if you believe that I am the same as before.
120.3: With this, I'll surely catch up to Mogamin.
120.4: Admiral, I wonder if you could please return my flight deck?
120.29: Really, Admiral... I thought you've forgotten about me.
120.24: Admiral, for taking such great care of me up until now, my gratitude is boundless. Umm.. If it's okay, afterwards, together with Mikuma…. Kumarinko!
120.8: Well, well! A new communique? Can I see it?
120.26: Would it be alright if I said 'Kumakuma'?
120.11: Please take special care with my flight deck.
120.12: Even though I though I fixed where Mogamin hit me.... I'm back in the dock...
120.6: Reporting that the repair has been completed.
120.5: I am informing you that a new ship has been completed.
120.7: The fleet has returned safely, thank goodness...
120.14: I want Mogamin to see this, my big performance!
120.15: Well now, lets begin my three-dimensional air AND surface actions!
120.16: Seaplanes, I'll leave this to you.
120.18: To be honest, nighttime is a little scary...
120.17: Next, the bombardment phase... Mi... Kuma!
120.23: Because the Admiral chose me, I could do my best! I humbly accept your gratitude.
120.19: Just how angry will you make me!
120.21: Aaa... Kumarinko's western clothes..! That's too much!
120.22: Please... Don't look... I don't want anyone... To see me while I sink...

120.34: It is now 0400. Admiral, why don't you just go to bed?
120.35: It's 0500. Admiral, if you work too hard, you damage your body.
120.37: 0700. Admiral, what would you like for breakfast?
120.38: 0800. Let's do our best together today as well, okay?
120.41: 1100. What should would you like for lunch?
120.42: 1200. I want to have lunch together~
120.43: 1300. You always get tired after eating, don't you?
120.45: 1500. Admiral, you're still holding strong here!
120.47: 1700. Admiral, it's already evening, isn't it?
120.48: 1800. Admiral, do you wish to go for dinner? Or perhaps, off for a drink?
120.49: 1900. Well, Admiral, it is tasty? ...thank goodness.
120.50: 2000. How about having a bath now?
120.51: 2100. Is it okay for me to have a rest now?
120.52: 2200. Admiral, it's almost time for that. Tha~t♪
120.53: 2300. I did my best today as well.

190.1: I'm Hatsukaze, nice to meet you. Admiral, how many of me did you have before me, I wonder?
190.25: Kagerou-class destroyer, Hatsukaze. Myoukou-neesan and I crashed into each other off Bougainville, and my bow got torn off... Crippled and unable to move, I was the target of concentrated fire and then... I'm scared....I'm so scared, Myoukou-neesan...
190.2: Ah... Admiral, thanks for the hard work.
190.3: Staaaare~ I'm just looking. Is that bad?
190.4: Hey! Just what are you touching! I'm going to hit you and fight you! Do you want me to tell Myoukou-neesan?!
190.29: Ah, geez, I'm so bored~! Admiral, do something~

190.12: I'm going to the bath. No peeking!

190.15: I'll say it straight...Myoukou-oneesan is scarier to me.
190.17: Why are you coming over here!
190.23: This battle that was led by Hatsukaze to victory, don't forget it now.
190.21: No, D-direct hit on the bow? I've already been hit there by Myoukou-oneesan once...it's been weakened...Aah...I'm scared...
190.22: I wanted Admiral to be so much more stronger so... I kept saying harsh things to him... sorry...

190.31: It's 1 A.M. It's really night-time, eh?
190.32: 2 A.M... huh. Not going to sleep soon?
190.34: 4 o'clock. If you don't go to bed soon then...
190.36: It's 6 o'clock. Admiral... all nighter? Perhaps?
190.37: It's 7 A.M. Admiral, let's have breakfast.
190.38: 8 o'clock. Looks like today's weather will be good as well.
190.39: It's 9 o'clock. Shall we go all out soon?♪
190.40: 10 o'clock! Somehow... I'm not really feeling it~
190.41: It's 11 o'clock. It'll soon be midday, yeah?
190.42: Midday. What are you doing for lunch? I want to eat something tasty~
190.43: 1 P.M. Why don't you take a nap?
190.44: It's 2 P.M~. I'm a bit sleepy at this time.
190.45: 3 P.M. I want to eat something sweet~
190.48: It's now 6 P.M. What's for dinner~?
190.49: 7 P.M. Admiral, let's eat dinner. I'm starving~
190.51: It's 9 P.M. Almost time for night battles, yeah?
190.52: 10 P.M. Sendai-neesan isn't here, it's nice and quiet.
190.53: The time is now, 11 P.M. Going to take a break soon?

122.1: Hello~! Kagerou-class destroyer, Maikaze! I'm not good in gloomy atmospheres!
122.25: Kagerou-class destroyer Maikaze! From Midway to the Southern Operations, I continued to dance across the battlefield. I'm good friends with Nowaki, a fellow Kagerou-class. When Truk Island was attacked, I almost made it.
122.2: Go~od morning! Wait, what time is it? Ah, I't doesn't m~atter!
122.4: O~h, the Admiral's in high spirits? Why don't we have a dance~?
122.28: Admiral~ come and dance with me~!
122.24: This is something I can only say to you, Admiral... truthfully, I can't help being scared... so I distract myself by dancing... But, with the Admiral by my side, everything is alright... can I stay close to you some more...?
122.9: You know, I'm getting too strong!
122.10: Remodeled ships are hu~ge!... just kidding.
122.27: I can dance some more now!
122.12: I danced too much~... Thanks for the full-body massage~
122.7: My elite fleet has come back to port~!
122.15: Okay! Let's have a magnificent dance!
122.18: Right there, a big jump and turn!
122.23: Admiral!... will you dance with me the next time too?
122.20: No... I can't dance well now...
122.21: This... If I dance, you'll see it!
122.22: Where's... Nowaki? Help me~. I hate it... I hate sinking!

122.33: It's 3 A.M. Your skin's going to get bad, probably~
122.34: 4 A.M, Admiral~ It's almost really morning, you know~
122.36: It's Morning! It's 6 A.M.! Admiral, let's prepare breakfast, okay?
122.38: It's now 8 A.M! Let's do our best today too!

122.40: It's 10 A.M. It's a nice wind, yes?
122.41: It's 11 A.M! I've been getting hungry~ maybe~....
122.43: It's 1 P.M. You have to move after eating, come on, a-one-two!
122.46: It's 4 P.M. Just about evening, right?
122.48: It's 6 P.M! What should be do for dinner? I think that something like cutlet would be great~!

122.53: It's now 11 P.M.~. Admiral, it's okay to take a break soon, yeah?

10.1: I'm Shirayuki. Thanks for having me.

10.9: For further success' I'll continue trying hard.
10.10: I'm happy...! Thank you very much...!
10.27: For future success' I'll try hard!
10.11: I think it can be repaired immediately.

10.5: Oh! The construction of the new ship seems to have completed.

10.14: Everyone, have you dumped the combustible material already?
10.18: This is the power of a special-type destroyer, please watch.
10.17: I have a feeling the barrage is thin.
10.23: I too, am happy that I was able to take part and support.
10.22: N-no... I still haven't done anything...

123.1: Ye~s, It's Miss Kinugasa's debut! Together with Aoba, take good care of me!
123.25: First to have a catapult equipped, Miss Kinugasa! Great to meet you. I performed magnificently in the capture of Wake Island and the Battle of the Coral Sea, and even the Solomon's Ironbottom Sound! But... planes, you know? I'm not really a fan...

123.4: If you keep touching me, I'll touch you back~ Hey hey!
123.29: Oi! Ooi! Oh, you're not Ooi? Ah, he glared at me.
123.24: Admiral, so that I can protect you, I'm gonna get stronger and stronger! But, if it get dangerous, you have to promise to get away, okay? I don't want to lose someone important to me.

123.46: 4 P.M., it's almost evening, isn't it~

235.9: Nice... I can rely on this.

235.6: I heard The repairs of the ship are completed.
235.5: It seems like fresh forces have been added.
235.7: The fleet has returned. Thanks for the hard work.
235.14: My name of reliance isn't just for show. Sortieing.
235.15: Well then, shall we do it?
235.23: Victory? I like the sound of that. Not a bad ring.
235.22: My true name is Hibiki... Dasvidanya... Farewell.
235.29: It's all right. Even if I am alone.

235.52: 2200. Everyone liked the borscht. I'm glad.

236.1: I'm Ikazuchi! Not 'Kaminari'! Please take care of that part too, okay!

236.16: You think an attack like that's gonna hit?

236.21: What, already! Ikazuchi will still be okay!
236.22: Commander...where are you...? I can't hear your voice anymore...

237.1: I'm Inazuma. Pleased to meet you.

237.23: I want to win the war, but I also want to save lives... Is that weird?

238.1: We are Hatsuharu. We thank you in advance.

As the clouds of war gathers, we did our duty in the Northern seas at such places as Attu and Kiska. The seas around Hokkaido are our favourite, no? The Gulf of Manila and Ormoc... ah, we are weak to the heat.

238.3: Yes, this is how you should be treating us.

238.21: 'Tis but a scratch! We shall not sink from just this!

239.1: Ye~s! It's Nenohi. Have you memorized my name? hey? Hey~!

134.1: Yuugumo-class destroyer, I am Makigumo. Following Yuugumo-neesan's example, I'll do my best!

134.9: Hmmhmmm! My new armament, how is it?

240.25: Third of the Hatsuharu-class, Wakaba. I participated in the Attu and Kiska Island exit operations. Yes, the Northern forces. Ah, be careful of heavy fog. It's easy to get hit. Especially 'Hatsushimo', you need to watch out for her.

At Guadalcanal, we gave an enemy ambush a beat down under the famous command of Rear Admiral Raizo Tanaka.

327.8: That's right, you always need to check your information. Isn't that common sense?

327.10: Oh my, yes. That was... quite helpful. Nice equipment... i think.
327.26: I'll take it off your hands!
327.27: That's right, supplies are important. Ah, I see, you knew that already, Commander.
327.11: I'm going to take a bath. Seriously, no peeking!
327.12: I'm getting in the bath. Geez, even though I said to properly service my turbine!

327.18: Night battle, huh. Yep, let's do this!

327.20: Tch... That hurts, you know! Quit it!
327.21: I...I've been beaten...but, I can still navigate..! As if I'll sink!
327.22: ...Fufu, Yamagumo... We're together again. It's not like I'm... like I'm lonely, you know...
327.30: Commander! It's gotten pretty late... I'll keep you company for today. It just became midnight, after all!
327.31: It's 0100! The night's a bit cold...
327.32: It's 0200...? What's with that face...? I'm not particularly sleepy or anything. you know?
327.33: It's 0300...? Commander... are you feeling drowsy? You have terrible bags under your eyes... Are you not getting enough sleep? Its fine if you have a nap, I'll be on night watch from here on.
327.34: Its 0400, huh... These early morning hours are cold... I don't hate it, though... What do you think, Commander... oh you fell asleep...?
327.35: It's 0500! Commander! Get up! We have to go wake everyone up soon! Hey, are you listening?
327.36: It's become 0600! Everyone, raise up! Okay? ...Commander? Are you even awake?
327.37: It's 0700! Breakfast time... bread is fine, isn't it? Toast? Aren't you demanding...here you go.
327.38: 0800... I'll take care of the plates, pass them here. Ah, the jam on the toast was good, wasn't it? Yamagumo gave it to me!
327.39: Its 0900. Its about time for the fleet to seriously start running...please use us destroyers well, too! Commander? Are you listening?

327.42: Its 1200 right? Commander, this is my best friend Yamagumo. She's a little weird, but please look after her! Uhh... Yamagumo, where are you going? Hey!
327.43: 1300. Commander, sorry...it seems like she had something on her mind...I'll ask her about it later! Sorry...how strange though...
327.44: Its 1400 now. As an apology for not eating lunch with you, I bought this at the canteen. We can eat this together...or rather, I'll give it to you, okay?
327.45: Its 1500 huh...Ah! It's Kirishima-san! Welcome back! Yes, Asagumo has been doing well! Yes!
327.46: Its 1600 now. Eh, my attitude towards Kirishima-san is different? Of course, that person is amazing! After all, I saw it! Mmm, I saw it!
327.47: 1700. It's about time to prepare dinner. Ah don't worry, I'll prepare it! I said I'll do it, don't worry about it!
327.48: Its 1800 now. Okay, dinner is served! Eh, you're complaining about the barley rice? What are you talking about, this is the basis of the dish! It's also very nutritious!
327.49: 1900. Hm? But the yellowtail teriyaki was delicious? I know right? It goes will with barley and rice, doesn't it?
327.50: It's become 2000. The night...the night is not my strong point. Ah, don't worry, I'm fine....now...
327.51: Its 2100 now. Oh, Yamagumo? What is it? No no, thats wrong! That's absolutely wrong! Jeez!
327.52: 2200. Yamagumo has some kind of misunderstanding...sometimes she goes into la-la land with her thoughts. She's usually pretty normal though...
327.53: Its 2300, huh...its completely nighttime now. The naval base is...not very quiet though. Yeah, I'll have to go give a warning.

142.1: Ye~s, It's Miss Kinugasa's debut! Together with Aoba, take good care of me!

142.42: Beep-beep-beep-pom~! 12 midday, time for lunch! My lunch is curry! What are yo~u having?

142.46: 4 P.M., it's almost evening, isn't it~

142.51: 9 P.M, oh? Someone's coming. Ah! It's Aoba! Good work today!

328.1: Good morning~~. Asashio Destroyer number six, Yamagumo. Please treat me well!

328.8: Information, I see. That's really important, isn't it?

328.12: Uh, I'm sorry~ I'll take it easy with a bath~
328.6: A girl have just came out of the bath~
328.7: The fleet has returned~. Oh, that's good~, isn't it?
328.14: Oh, Asagumo-nee? Do you want to go together?
328.16: Uh-huh~ I want to hit as much as possible~

328.20: No~ Yamagumo is weak against attacks~!
328.21: I guess I need to get a bi~t more serious.

328.32: 02...00! Midnight's over~ For some reason, I feel pretty nervous around this time...

328.39: 09...00! Oh right, during today's lunch, I'm going with Asagumo on a date! A date...isn't that nice? I'm looking forward to it!

328.41: 11...00! Commander, how do I look? I look fine? Alright, I'm heading out!

328.46: 16...00! If you boil these vegetables, add a lot of sugar and make it into a jam, its surprisingly tasty! See?

328.50: 20..00! After this, I'm going on a date with Asagumo again, I can't wait! My tie isn't crooked right? I feel nervous~

329.52: 2200. Commander, it's a quiet night. It would be nice if all nights could be like this, huh.

330.28: Commander, thanks as always. This Akizuki will protect the fleet, and you. Yeah, it's alright!
330.24: Commander, did you call me? Um, was my anti-air inadequate? That's not it? Then does it have to do with Shoukaku-san? Not that either? ...Howaa~, could this be... T-thank you very much!

330.13: Anti-air destroyer, Akizuki. Prepared to sortie.
330.10: With this, I won't lose to the enemy fleet!

I believe I'll be a great help in furthering what the fleet attains out of it's drills, for sure. Eh, my firepower in comparison to a battleship... is it? I wonder, tactics-wise, how it is.

343.22: It's...no good... At least, I got launched...aa..ah...

400.1: Guten Tag ... ah, my mistake... sorry, please call me "hachi".

163.2: I-I shouldn't be afraid...of the Fleet Girls...you say?
163.3: Maruyu will be carrying your luggage. Yep, we’ll be doing a mole run.
163.4: No! Don’t look at me like that, please!

163.24: S..Sir. To care for Maruyu this much... Maruyu is touched! I'll keep on doing my best!

163.39: 0900 hours. Okay, sir! Let’s switch the mood, and march on forward!

163.41: 1100 hours. It’s almost time for a fun lunch!

164.27: Is it alright for me to get this?

165.21: I got beat-pyon... huu..., I want to take a bath-pyon...
165.22: This is farewell... for U-chan pyon? Commander... don't cry, okay?

166.40: 1000 hours. A daily mission is fine too.
166.41: 1100 hours. This morning's mission is coming to an end. Let us do our best.

167.1: 12th Kagerou-class destroyer, Isokaze. Don't worry, I will protect you.

I've fought again and again, participated in decisive battles, and fought to the bitter end. Yamato, Musashi, Kongou, Taihou... their last moments have been etched into my eyes. This time... I will protect them.

169.22: Even I, Tanikaze can't avoid it... It can't be help. I dare... to be sunk, eek...

170.3: Shinano...this time I'll keep you safe.

171.18: I won't let you escape... Don't underestimate me!

174.1: Good morning. I'm Leberecht Maass. Lebe is fine, yep.
174.25: The German-born destroyer, the first genuine large-type. This shifted high temperature, high pressure engine, it could only have been designed in the country of technical skills! I'm not so great at open-sea warfare though... I'll do my best!
174.2: Nn, what is it? My boiler needs servicing...
174.4: Admiral, what is it? Is this one of this country's greetings? It's going to be difficult until I'm used to it.
174.29: Ah, It's not that I'm bored, I'm just fine, yep.
174.28: Admiral, you're always working so hard, aren't you. But, you shouldn't push yourself so much. I'll work with you.
174.24: Admiral, why the serious face? Eh? What's this box... O-oh. Thank you.
174.8: Looking at the report? Analysis is important.
174.11: Ah, they got me. I've gotta get fixed.
174.6: Admiral, a comrade's repairs have been completed.
174.5: Admiral, looks like a new comrade is here.
174.14: Not commerce raiding, but a fleet battle?... I- I can do it!
174.15: Fleet battle, huh... Okay, here I go!
174.18: Night battle huh, I'll give it a shot
174.23: I did the best? Oh... that's great, yep.
174.21: The engine room is alright, I can still sail forth.
174.22: I'm sinking, once again, huh. But, this time... it was in a real battle...

174.32: 2 o'clock. I wonder if Max is still going?
174.33: 3 o'clock. Ngh... Admiral, aren't you tired? Wow, that's impressive.
174.35: 5 o'clock. It's morning, some new missions have come.
174.36: Good morning. 6 o'clock. Admiral, good day to you.
174.37: 7 o'clock. Breakfast time, yeah? I'll go and get it started.
174.38: 8 o'clock. Admiral, how's the Nürnberger Rostbratwurst? Was it tasty?
174.39: 9 o'clock. Almost time for serious action, yeah?
174.40: 10 o'clock. About time to sortie. But, I've gotta be careful of mines.
174.41: 11 o'clock. I won't confuse fishing boats and enemy vessels, yep. Naturally.
174.42: 12 o'clock. Lunch time. What would be good for lunch, Admiral?
174.43: It's 13 o'clock. I wonder if Max is okay, I'm a bit worried.
174.44: It's 14 o'clock. Practice is important, even in the North Sea, yep.
174.45: 15 o'clock. Talking about seaworthiness...nah, I'm just wondering...
174.46: 16 o'clock. It's okay, I can do it.
174.47: 17 o'clock. It's getting a little dark, yep.
174.48: 18 o'clock. What shall we do for dinner?
174.49: The Sauerkraut and Eisbein, how is it? Admiral, is it tasty? Ah, 19 o'clock.
174.51: 21 o'clock. About time for night battles, yeah? I'm not so great at those.
174.52: 22 o'clock. It's amazing, everybody here just loves night battles, I'm surprised.
174.53: 23 o'clock. Admiral, thanks for everything today. Let's do our best tomorrow too!

175.1: Good day. I am the Destroyer Max Schultz. But, Max is fine. Pleased to meet you.
175.25: Zerstörer 1934 program, third ship. I was designed with good survivability, but... these new turbines have a small issue with maintenance. This time... I shall be alright.
175.3: What? Don't touch me that much.
175.4: You... Does that action have anything to do with an operation? Really? Hmm, I see...
175.29: Hrmm... is there nothing to do? I see... there's really no battles? H~mm...
175.28: Hey, why don't you stop straining so much. Let's take it easy. It'll be alright.
175.24: What is this important business?... Oh, this is for me? Y-you.. h~mm... I-I see... That's how it is... h~mm. Thank you very much.
175.12: Docking for some large-scale repairs. Goodbye for now.
175.6: Looks like a ship was fully repaired.
175.5: It appears that a new ship has been completed.
175.14: Let's show them our true power. Casting off!
175.15: Fleet... battle, huh... Off I go!
175.16: The enemy is trapped, beginning the attack.
175.23: Oh? I'm number one? H~mm... I-I really am? H~mm...
175.21: I got hit... W-what? A Mine? I was mistaken...?
175.22: To be sunk in this strange ocean... I shall... be sleeping once again...
175.30: It's 0 o'clock. H~mm, it's quite late.
175.31: It's 1 o'clock. You're still awake? Such zeal.
175.32: It's 2 o'clock. I wonder if Lebe is still up too?
175.33: It is 3 o'clock. Hey, you dozed off there just now. Why not take a break soon?
175.34: It's 4 o'clock. H~mm, you're a bit peckish? It's better to not eat anything right now, you know.
175.36: It is 6 o'clock. During the morning, let's clear everything up.
175.38: It's 8 o'clock. For breakfast, would Roggenbrot and cheese be okay? Do you like rye bread?
175.39: It is 9 o'clock. Well now, let us reorganize the fleet. Which ship do you wish to drop?
175.40: It 's 10 o'clock. Sea mines are a bit of a landmine for me... as are puns.
175.41: It is 11 o'clock. You're still hungry? Was breakfast not enough?
175.42: It's 12 o'clock. Lunch. It can't be helped, let's have a fulfilling lunch.
175.43: It's 13 o'clock. How about some Baumkuchen for dessert? It's not too heavy?
175.44: It is 14 o'clock. Oh yes, I would like to form a fleet with the rumored Bismarck, I think.
175.45: It is 15 o'clock. H~mm, what is it? You're all restless, aren't you? Don't worry.
175.46: It's 16 o'clock. If you're tired, let's go and have a break.
175.47: It's 17 o'clock. Are you doing well? H~mm, I see. Don't push yourself too hard.
175.48: It is 18 o'clock. I'll prepare for dinner.
175.49: It is 19 o'clock. Yes, Admiral, all the preparation is complete.
175.50: It's 20 o'clock. Admiral, would you like some coffee?
175.51: 21 o'clock. I'm not particularly fond of night battles, I'd rather take a break around now.
175.52: It is 22 o'clock. To prepare for tomorrow, I shall be taking my leave shortly.

176.1: Good morning! I'm the heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen. Nice to meet you!
176.25: Oh! You surprised me! I, German-born heavy cruiser, Prinz Eugen! Admiral Hipper class, third ship. With big sister Bismarck, I took part in Operation Rheinübung. Lucky fleet ... really? I will keep fighting in this sea too!
176.2: Oh! You surprised me! ..Ah, yes! Setting off!
176.4: Admiraal! Is it the Rhine Exercise? ...Ah.. So I was mistaken.. It's okay! I'll still work hard! Leave it to me!
176.29: Bismarck Nee-sama... I wonder if she's okay...? I'm kind of curious... Maybe I should go see what she's doing?
176.28: Fuwaa, Admiral-san, if you're tired, you need to take a break. Definitely! Got it!?
176.24: Admiral-san, you said you needed something? Wah, t-this is for me? Uh, umm~, Bismarck Nee-sama is... a-ah... u-um, ...Thank you! I'll treasure it!!

176.13: Heavy Cruiser Prinz Eugen, setting off!
176.11: Haa... I got hit. I'll get fixed soon
176.6: Ship in dock is fully repaired!
176.5: It looks like new ships have been commissioned. Looking forward to it!
176.7: Operation complete! Thank you for the hard work~
176.14: Bismarck Nee-sama, let's head out together!
176.17: Main guns... carefully aim... firing, commence!

176.19: Uwaa I got hit! But, I'm not done yet..!
176.20: Uu...I need to snap out of it...
176.21: I'll get laughed at by Bismarck Nee-sama like this..!
176.22: This time I'll go on ahead... Sakawa... Nagato... See you...

176.31: It's 1am! Is something like this good? Ah, I see! Thank goodness!
176.32: It's 2am. In this country, you say... Ushi, Mitsu, Doki? Aah, they are funny sounding words.
176.33: Waa, you startled me! Ah, do you like... this hairstyle? Aah! It's 3am!
176.34: Nnn~... It's 4am~... nn... As expected, I'm a bit tired... But, I'm fine.

176.36: 6 o'clock. Breakfast, huh... eh? Me!? Got it, leave it to me! Umm... hmm, what should I make? I wonder if I should make Bismarck Nee-sama's portion too? Right?
176.37: Ok, today's breakfast is bread, cheese, and sausage. Also salad... and of course, have some hot coffee! It's pretty average, but still good, right? Ah, it's exactly 7 o'clock now.
176.38: It's now 8 o'clock. Now, Admiral-san, let's do today's missions! Will you start with exercises? Or maybe, expeditions?
176.39: It's 9am. Hm? Ah, it's Nagato! Ooy, Na-gato! ...hm? Where have we met? That is, of course! ...uh... huh? Umm... where was it...?
176.40: It's 10 o'clock. Battleship? 'Course! If I'm with Bismarck Nee-sama, we'll sink them in no time! Leave it to me!
176.41: It's now 11am~. It's almost noon, huh~. It might be nice to eat outside today.
176.42: Ah, it's already noon! It's midday! For lunch, is cheese and bread outside ok? Since it's nice, shall we have a beer too? Aha, no good, huh...
176.43: It's now 13 o'clock. Time to start the afternoon missions. Let's do our best!
176.44: 14 o'clock. Eh? What, Sakawa? Ah, I know her, she's that cute light cruiser.
176.45: 15 o'clock. Aah, this? It's my fittings from Operation Cerberus. How is it, does it suit me~?
176.46: It's now 16 o'clock. Waa, you startled me, Bismarck Nee-sama! Shall we sortie together? Yes, by all means.
176.47: 17 o'clock. It's evening now. It's about time for the day to be getting darker. Haa, such a beautiful sky... Ah, of course Bismarck Nee-sama is the most beautiful!
176.48: It's 18 o'clock. I'll start preparing dinner. Is kaltes essen ok for today? Eh, it's not? Something warm would be better?
176.49: It's 19 o'clock. Well then, dinner is Eisbein pot-au-feu. It's fine if the flavor soaks into the soup, right? And finally, if you add in rice to make it a porridge, it's delicious!
176.50: It's now 20 o'clock. Japanese cruisers are pretty well-rounded, huh? Mmhmm. Aah, I see... Mmhmm.
176.51: 21 o'clock. Eh, a... signature move? Let's see, I spent a lot of time shelling hordes of advancing enemy tanks! I'm pretty good at that! Yes!
176.52: 22 o'clock, it's completely nighttime now. Admiral-san, good work on today's operations too.
176.53: It's 23 o'clock. Hm~ it's about time I took a break too... Gute Nacht... Eh, I can't~?

178.4: Admiral, it seems that your fleet is lacking in discipline. I shall instruct you from the basics.

178.28: Admiral, no matter what it is, it's bad to work too hard, okay? A change of pace is also a good thing, you know?
178.24: Admiral, what is it? Such an earnest expression... This is for me? ...I-I see... Y-you can give it to me. I won't give this back, you know? Definitely...
178.8: What is it? Has the situation changed for the better?
178.13: Battleship Bismarck, setting sail! Sally forth!
178.27: My thanks. I can continue to fight with this.

178.5: It appears that a new ship has been commissioned.
178.7: Operation complete, the fleet has returned to port.
178.14: I shall show you how Bismarck fights!
178.15: A fleet battle... I'm itching for a fight!
178.18: I won't let you escape... Don't underestimate me!
178.23: I am number one? What are you saying, of course that's the case. Is that not good? You can praise me more.
178.19: Guh! Ahh! This reminds me of those annoying biplanes...! (zwei)
178.21: They got me...! The rudder! Is the rudder alright!?... Well then, I can continue on...from here.
178.22: Once again, I shall return to Brest... I exchanged enough shells... I'm...satisfied...

178.31: 1 A.M. Admiral, is it not about time for bed?
178.32: 2 A.M. *ya~wn*... Of course, I'm tired also...
178.33: 3 A.M. You will rise properly tomorrow, yes? Could you please be punctual in the morning?
178.34: 4 A.M. I shall take a short nap. All-nighters are bad for the skin.
178.35: It's 5 A.M. Alrighty, get up! Good morning!
178.36: 6 A.M. Well now, Admiral, let's go and get all the morning affairs in order!
178.37: 7 A.M. Admiral, it is time for breakfast. What have you prepared for me?
178.38: 8 A.M. This Admiral-made breakfast is pretty good. Japanese-style isn't bad.
178.39: 9 A.M. Well now, let us up and go and start today's commerce raiding! ...Eh, I'm mistaken?
178.40: 10 A.M. Kongou? Nagato? No, I don't know them. Who are they? Are they strong?
178.41: It's 11 A.M... Yamato-class? That's got a strong feeling to it. I'd like to meet them.
178.42: I am informing you that is it now 12 midday. Well now, what would be good for lunch?
178.43: 1 P.M. Oh, those destroyers of a familiar ship class are here. I know those kids.
178.44: 2 P.M. I wonder if Scharnhorst has also come here. I still would like to meet her.
178.45: It's 3 P.M. I'd like to eat a little something sweet. Hey Admiral, did you hear me?
178.46: 4 P.M. Almost evening, no? Shall we leave it at this?
178.47: 5 P.M. Phew~, today was hard work as well. Well now, shall we stop at this checkpoint for today?
178.48: 6 P.M. Almost time for dinner. Admiral, what kind of menu do you have for me?
178.49: It is 7 P.M. The Admiral's sauerkraut has an odd flavor... Oh, this is 'tsukemono', you say?
178.50: 8 P.M. It's really night now... It's bad for my skin, so could we not go on a night battle?
178.51: 9 P.M. H~mm, Japanese battleships have such tall bridges. Those sisters sure are something.
178.52: It's 10 P.M. I shall take a rest soon.
178.53: 11 P.M. Admiral, are you still going? Good night.

179.1: Good morning. I'm Leberecht Maass. Lebe is fine, yep.
179.25: The German-born destroyer, the first genuine large-type. This shifted high temperature, high pressure engine, it could only have been designed in the country of technical skills! I'm not so great at open-sea warfare though... I'll do my best!
179.2: Nn, what is it? My boiler needs servicing...
179.4: Admiral, what is it? Is this one of this country's greetings? It's going to be difficult until I'm used to it.
179.29: Ah, It's not that I'm bored, I'm just fine, yep.
179.28: Admiral, you're always working so hard, aren't you. But, you shouldn't push yourself so much. I'll work with you.
179.24: Admiral, why the serious face? Eh? What's this box... O-oh. Thank you.
179.8: Looking at the report? Analysis is important.
179.11: Ah, they got me. I've gotta get fixed.
179.6: Admiral, a comrade's repairs have been completed.
179.5: Admiral, looks like a new comrade is here.
179.14: Not commerce raiding, but a fleet battle?... I- I can do it!
179.15: Fleet battle, huh... Okay, here I go!
179.18: Night battle huh, I'll give it a shot
179.23: I did the best? Oh... that's great, yep.
179.21: The engine room is alright, I can still sail forth.
179.22: I'm sinking, once again, huh. But, this time... it was in a real battle...
179.30: Midnight. It's a new day, yeah?
179.32: 2 o'clock. I wonder if Max is still going?
179.33: 3 o'clock. Ngh... Admiral, aren't you tired? Wow, that's impressive.
179.35: 5 o'clock. It's morning, some new missions have come.
179.36: Good morning. 6 o'clock. Admiral, good day to you.
179.37: 7 o'clock. Breakfast time, yeah? I'll go and get it started.
179.38: 8 o'clock. Admiral, how's the Nürnberger Rostbratwurst? Was it tasty?
179.39: 9 o'clock. Almost time for serious action, yeah?
179.40: 10 o'clock. About time to sortie. But, I've gotta be careful of mines.
179.41: 11 o'clock. I won't confuse fishing boats and enemy vessels, yep. Naturally.
179.42: 12 o'clock. Lunch time. What would be good for lunch, Admiral?
179.43: It's 13 o'clock. I wonder if Max is okay, I'm a bit worried.
179.44: It's 14 o'clock. Practice is important, even in the North Sea, yep.
179.45: 15 o'clock. Talking about seaworthiness...nah, I'm just wondering...
179.46: 16 o'clock. It's okay, I can do it.
179.47: 17 o'clock. It's getting a little dark, yep.
179.48: 18 o'clock. What shall we do for dinner?
179.49: The Sauerkraut and Eisbein, how is it? Admiral, is it tasty? Ah, 19 o'clock.
179.51: 21 o'clock. About time for night battles, yeah? I'm not so great at those.
179.52: 22 o'clock. It's amazing, everybody here just loves night battles, I'm surprised.
179.53: 23 o'clock. Admiral, thanks for everything today. Let's do our best tomorrow too!

14.1: I'm Shikinami. I'll be in your care.
14.25: Special Destroyer number II, Shikinami. Nice to meet you. After participating in Midway and the Battle of Solomon, I serve as a convoy escort. Being a convoy escort is really rough you know... Because it's important...
14.3: What is it, I'm busy here...
14.4: Don't call me if you don't have business with me... It's not like I hate it.
14.29: Hurn, person like Shikinami will be forgotten anyway... Well, that's fine... that's not fine...
14.28: Commander… It's not good to work so hard. … Hey, take your time!
14.24: Commander, yeah, I've got something I wanna tell you, nah, it's not a complaint or anything, you know? Erm.. Umm… man, I can't say it!
14.8: It's the letter. Be sure to look at?
14.13: Well, let go~! It's time for sortie!
14.9: Eh? Is it all right to strengthen someone like me. It's nothing?
14.10: What is it, to invest toward someone like me... I-it's alright.
14.27: Huh? Are you fine with it, strengthening someone like me, that is. Nothing's gonna come out of this, you know?
14.11: Yayy, well then I'll get myself repaired.
14.12: Haa, it's was dangerous. I'll go to the dock.
14.6: The ship's repairs have finished. She's probably all pretty now, isn't she? Hurm.
14.5: A new ship just joined. I bet she's a cute kid... hurm.
14.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned.
14.14: Shikinami! Sailing! Don't worry about me.
14.18: Night battle huh... Well, it's fine because I'm good at it.
14.17: In the end, it's my turn huh.
14.23: Commander! I'm awesome right? Right? Ah, no, I don't care about that at all...
14.21: Hurm, I don't that I'll lose because I'm worn out!

180.1: Good day. I am the Destroyer Max Schultz. But, Max is fine. Pleased to meet you.
180.25: Zerstörer 1934 program, third ship. I was designed with good survivability, but... these new turbines have a small issue with maintenance. This time... I shall be alright.
180.3: What? Don't touch me that much.
180.4: You... Does that action have anything to do with an operation? Really? Hmm, I see...
180.29: Hrmm... is there nothing to do? I see... there's really no battles? H~mm...
180.28: Hey, why don't you stop straining so much. Let's take it easy. It'll be alright.
180.24: What is this important business?... Oh, this is for me? Y-you.. h~mm... I-I see... That's how it is... h~mm. Thank you very much.
180.12: Docking for some large-scale repairs. Goodbye for now.
180.6: Looks like a ship was fully repaired.
180.5: It appears that a new ship has been completed.
180.14: Let's show them our true power. Casting off!
180.15: Fleet... battle, huh... Off I go!
180.16: The enemy is trapped, beginning the attack.
180.23: Oh? I'm number one? H~mm... I-I really am? H~mm...
180.21: I got hit... W-what? A Mine? I was mistaken...?
180.22: To be sunk in this strange ocean... I shall... be sleeping once again...
180.30: It's 0 o'clock. H~mm, it's quite late.
180.31: It's 1 o'clock. You're still awake? Such zeal.
180.32: It's 2 o'clock. I wonder if Lebe is still up too?
180.33: It is 3 o'clock. Hey, you dozed off there just now. Why not take a break soon?
180.34: It's 4 o'clock. H~mm, you're a bit peckish? It's better to not eat anything right now, you know.
180.36: It is 6 o'clock. During the morning, let's clear everything up.
180.38: It's 8 o'clock. For breakfast, would Roggenbrot and cheese be okay? Do you like rye bread?
180.39: It is 9 o'clock. Well now, let us reorganize the fleet. Which ship do you wish to drop?
180.40: It 's 10 o'clock. Sea mines are a bit of a landmine for me... as are puns.
180.41: It is 11 o'clock. You're still hungry? Was breakfast not enough?
180.42: It's 12 o'clock. Lunch. It can't be helped, let's have a fulfilling lunch.
180.43: It's 13 o'clock. How about some Baumkuchen for dessert? It's not too heavy?
180.44: It is 14 o'clock. Oh yes, I would like to form a fleet with the rumored Bismarck, I think.
180.45: It is 15 o'clock. H~mm, what is it? You're all restless, aren't you? Don't worry.
180.46: It's 16 o'clock. If you're tired, let's go and have a break.
180.47: It's 17 o'clock. Are you doing well? H~mm, I see. Don't push yourself too hard.
180.48: It is 18 o'clock. I'll prepare for dinner.
180.49: It is 19 o'clock. Yes, Admiral, all the preparation is complete.
180.50: It's 20 o'clock. Admiral, would you like some coffee?
180.51: 21 o'clock. I'm not particularly fond of night battles, I'd rather take a break around now.
180.52: It is 22 o'clock. To prepare for tomorrow, I shall be taking my leave shortly.

181.1: Is a nice breeze coming? It's time for me, the next generation destroyer prototype, Amatsukaze, to debut.
181.25: I'm Amatsukaze, the Ninth Kagerou-class Destroyer. I was tasked with being the test bed of a new type of high-temperature, high pressure boiler meant for the next generation of destroyer. With the data in tow, I was able to hand this over to Shimakaze. I was in many tight spots, but I have been able to constantly overcome them. It was really tough!
181.3: I wonder what kind of wind is blowing.
181.4: Stop it, don't touch my hair. You'll mess up the windsock.
181.29: Eh? It's not like I'm bored or anything. I have a lot to do after getting the data for the new boiler. I-I'm not lying!
181.28: You...you should take a break from time to time, they are important too...are you even listening? Honestly...
181.24: You, what is this exactly? Eh? For me? Ummm...I'll take it I guess... You... you're really fine with it being me? Thank you.
181.8: So how are you doing? ...Hmmmmmm. Not bad I suppose.
181.11: Haa, I'm tired. May I head back?
181.12: Bathtime, bathtime I say! I don't want to smell all sweaty.

181.5: A new girl has arrived. ...Not that I mind.
181.7: The fleet has returned. Thanks for the good work.

181.16: I won't let you escape! This is a good wind... commencing attack!
181.18: Didn't I said that I won't let you escape?
181.17: It's all right...a good wind is blowing!
181.23: I'm...Amatsukaze is the distinguished ship? M-my, isn't it fine? How's this, Tokitsukaze?
181.21: Ahh, the bow and the first cannon's been hit! Even so, I won't sink!
181.22: I finally sank into the sea this time... It's so cold... and dark...
181.31: 0100 yawn~ I'm a little sleepy now. Are you not going to sleep yet?
181.32: 0200 I wonder, has Hatsukaze slept yet? Yukikaze is already sleeping, huh... yup.
181.33: 0300 No way... You're gonna stay up all night today? I'm not staying up with you.
181.34: 0400 Geez... I said I'm not staying up with you... You're stubborn... It's already morning.
181.36: 0600 But still...the morning breeze feels good. Hey, do you agree?
181.37: 0700 ...The wind feels good, right? Heey~ wanna spend some time off the coast?
181.38: 0800 Ok, your breakfast is ready. You are fine with Japanese breakfast right?
181.39: 0900 It's time for full scale fleet action soon. What's your plan?

181.42: 1200 I wonder if the curry is fine as your lunch? It's my speciality! really!
181.43: 1300 How was my curry? hmm? Glad to hear that!
181.44: 1400 Shimakaze and me, who is faster? I wouldn't know even if you asked... because I've never competed with her before.
181.45: 1500 Speed is not a problem. I was tested a lot because I'm a prototype.
181.46: 1600 Weird...why is rensouhou-kun in a bad mood?
181.47: 1700 The evening breeze feels good too... wanna view the sunset here, together?
181.48: 1800 It's time for dinner soon. Are you fine with grilled fish?
181.49: 1900 ...Ok, here's your dinner... How was it? Was it good?... I see... I'm glad~!
181.50: 2000 Oh... Shimakaze, how are you? ehh? ...What? A race!? I'm not gonna do it! It's night...
181.51: 2100 I just said I don't want to race! You're so persistent, Shimakaze!
181.52: 2200 S-She finally left... Geez... What's wrong with her!
181.53: 2300 The day is ending soon. Good job, see you tomorrow.

182.1: I'm Repair ship Akashi. If you take a little damage, I can fix you up in the base. Just leave it to me!
182.25: I'm Akashi, the only dedicated repair ship in the combined fleet. I was in charge of repairing ships damaged in the front lines when I was stationed in the Truk Anchorage. I supported the fleet from behind right up until the destruction of the Anchorage. Pleased to meet you.
182.3: Admiral, you need repairs? Have you been damaged somewhere?
182.4: It's dangerous, so don't touch my cranes... hey! That's even more dangerous!
182.29: Right... don't worry! I'm busy with things such as repairs and procuring new machinery! So don't worry! ... really...
182.28: Admiral... you've gotta make sure you fix yourself up sometimes. Just leave the maintenance... to me, okay?
182.24: Admiral, what is it? You want to process the ring in my factory? Geez... I wonder who the lucky person is? Ehh... for me?! No way...! I-I'll treasure it! Thank you!
182.8: Do you want to check the fleet's operational status, Admiral?
182.9: Now...this is what I call progress!
182.10: Now I can repair even more! Thank you so much!
182.11: I guess even I need maintenance once in a while...
182.12: Phew... what a blessing it is to have people washing my back. Thanks so much.
182.5: It seems like a new ship has been completed. Looking forward to it.
182.7: The fleet has returned safely. Phew.
182.15: Fighting isn't my... well... but I guess I'll just have to do it!
182.18: A pursuit... w-what am I supposed to do about that?!
182.17: It's not my forte, but here we go...!
182.23: Eh...EEEEEH!? M-me!? How did that happen...? Well, can't say I'm not happy...
182.19: Geh... ouch... is my factory fine?
182.20: I'm hit...don't let the fire spread to the work machines!
182.21: I...I was targetted!? I can't do a good repair job in this state!
182.22: Seems like I'm heading towards the sea floor... guess I can have another long sleep. Good night.
182.30: 0000, Midnight... Shouldn't you be resting soon?
182.31: 0100. Aren't you sleepy after all? Eh? Me? I'm fine!
182.32: 0200. I've somehow remembered my time at Truk... I sure worked hard.
182.33: 0300. About Palau… I wonder why? I don't really remember much of it.
182.34: 0400. It's morning soon, yeah? Admiral? You sure you're fine with not sleeping tonight?
182.35: 0500. The sky is gradually getting brighter! It's a brand new day!
182.36: 0600. Admiral? What will you have for breakfast? It's not anywhere near Mamiya's level, but my cooking is unexpectedly good, you know?
182.37: 0700. It's morning, huh. Should we go and wake the sleepy heads up?
182.38: 0800, huh. Now! Time to get the repairs on!
182.39: 0900. Which ship would you like me to repair? …Eh!? It can't be… a sortie!?
182.40: 1000. …Admiral? For me, battles are a bit… ah… no… even if you load me with all these weapons…
182.41: 1100. You're too reckless admiral. It'll be hell if the work machines broke down!
182.42: 1200. It's afternoon! It's Akashi curry time! What do you say?!
182.43: 1300. I'll be doing the inspection of ship interior factory! There's quite a lot of it~
182.44: 1400. It's about time I dive fully into the afternoon repairs, okay?
182.45: 1500. Admiral? Don't you feel a little hungry now? Hmm?
182.46: 1600. Mamiya Monaka is really tasty, isn't it! I would like to make some in the ship too...
182.47: 1700. The sun will be setting soon. Oof… It's been tiring, yeah.
182.48: 1800. Do you want to eat out for dinner? Like the Yamato hotel, perhaps... just a joke, really.
182.49: 1900. I'm sorry it's only something simple, but dinner is ready!
182.50: 2000 I guess a full stomach really makes you sleepy, huh… Yaaawnn… Ah-- I shouldn't!
182.51: 2100, huh. The day will be ending in three more hours. Thanks for the good work.
182.52: 2200 Nights at the anchorage sure is quiet, huh… It'll be nice if it stays like this…
182.53: 2300 Admiral? Thank you for your hard work for today!

183.1: Admiral, Light Cruiser Ooyodo has joined the battle lines. Please leave the fleet administration & supervision to me.
183.25: Designed as a cutting edge C&C flagship, the newest light cruiser, Ooyodo. There was a problem with the installation of the specified new model recon, & the battle situation changed, so I wasn't really able to undertake my role as the combined fleet flagship. However, I participated in the Northern Operation & the Operation Rei-Go. I, too, will do my best on the front lines.
183.2: Yes. Please leave it to me. Admiral, it's really starting to feel like Autumn now, right? (Seasonal Line) Admiral, Winter is a bit quiet, right? (Seasonal Line)
183.3: Admiral, is that perhaps a communication method? Straight talk would be better, I think. Yes.
183.4: Admiral, that's not communications equipment. Careless touching - it reflects poorly on the fleet's command.
183.29: Admiral, it is time for the next mission... Oh, Admiral? Admiral? Did you hear me? Hey?
183.28: Admiral, for always treasuring Ooyodo, I really thank you. I’ve been watching all this time you know? Have you noticed?
183.24: Admiral, did you call for Ooyodo? Eh, is this for me? Thank you so much, Admiral. I'll treasure this forever.
183.8: Admiral, I've organized our fleet's intelligence.
183.9: A remodel for me? Thank you so much.
183.10: I see. It seems that I want to be loaded with torpedoes... However...
183.27: Supply & logistics, they are important, no?
183.11: I am really sorry. I'll fall back a little.
183.12: I have no excuse. I would be happy if you would give me a little free time.
183.6: The repairs on the ship in the dock have completed.
183.5: A new ship has been completed.
183.7: Fleet, the mission was a success. Good work everyone!
183.14: Combined fleet's flagship, Ooyodo, casting off!
183.15: Enemy fleet spotted. Ready the cannons, please!
183.18: Remember the Operation Rei-Go. All ships, sally forth!
183.17: Fleet movement is... Yes, good job everyone.
183.23: Eh, my accomplishments were the greatest? My, how unexpected. But I'm somewhat proud, ufufu.
183.20: No way... A starboard list? Flood the ballast!
183.21: Geh, they got me! B-but, I won't sink yet. Ooyodo, will not sink!
183.22: Damage control, hurry! Eh, it's no good? It's no good! Admiral, it looks like this is the end of the line. We'll meet sometime, somewhere, I'm sure...
183.30: Admiral, the day has changed. Let's have a great day today, too.
183.31: Admiral, it is now 0100. Leave the time reporting to me, Ooyodo.
183.32: Admiral, it's 0200. Oh? Admiral, are you perhaps tired?
183.33: 0300. While the Admiral takes a break, I shall re-examine the fleet administration's plans.
183.34: It is now 0400. The Admiral's sleeping face is so cute! Ufufu, I profited a bit!
183.35: It's 0500. Admiral, it's morning. Time to wake all the members! Wake them all!
183.36: 0600. Admiral, I have completed the breakfast prep. I tried putting rice-bread in the miso!
183.37: It is now 0700. Admiral, have you finished your breakfast? I shall clean up, okay?
183.38: 0800. Okay! Fleet practice! Let's make it a strict one!
183.39: Admiral, it's 0900. After drills is sorting, yes? The sortie plan is over here.
183.40: It's 1000. Tone-san is here today too, no? Tone-saaaan!
183.41: 1100. Tone-san & Chikuma-san are such good friends... I'm a little jealous...
183.42: 1200. Admiral, Let's have curry for lunch - Military Band curry.

183.44: It is now 1400. Oh my? Ashigara-san. What's the matter? I see.

183.53: Admiral, it's 2300. Thank you once again for a hard day's work. Let's do our best tomorrow, too.

184.1: Good day, I'm Submarine Tender Taigei. I may be inexperienced, but I am glad to be of service.
184.25:
I'm Submarine Tender Taigei.
I serve as flagship of submarine fleets in order to support operations through supplies and usage of scout planes. I have also been designed as a carrier backup to be converted if it is needed. I'll do my best!

184.4: Um, you're asking me what's in here? Onions, potatoes... and torpedoes for supply use... yeah...
