184.6: Thank goodness, it seems like the reparation has been completed.
184.5: Oh my! Seems like a new friend has joined us.
184.7: The fleet has safely returned. What a relief.
184.15: Enemy fleet sighted! ...W-what should I do?
184.18: A fleet battle with these armaments... it might be impossible!
184.23: Eh... no way! M-me?! T-thank you so much... I'll keep giving it my all!
184.21: Wha- a direct hit?! N-no more... increase the rate of draining! I'm gonna sink...!
184.22: Eh... I'm... sinking? So this is what it's like... to be in the water...

185.1: Carrier Ryuuhou, remodeled from a Submarine Tender. I'll once again try my best as a carrier!
185.25: Carrier Ryuuhou, remodeled from a Submarine Tender. My speed was not up to plan specifications as there were issues with changing the boilers, but I have an enhanced flight deck and armaments as this Light Carrier class. Carrier Ryuuhou, giving it her all!

404.48: 1800. Admiral, it's time for dinner. What would you like? Er...
404.49: 1900. What's the matter, Shigure? Eh, provisions? Thank you, you saved me.
404.50: 2000. Admiral, Shigure has brought us provisions of onigiri and pickled daikon radish.
404.51: 2100. Admiral, we have already had it for lunch. But Shigure's onigiri is delicious, isn't it? Ufufu.
404.52: Now is 2200, Admiral. It's completely night & becoming much quieter now.
404.53: Admiral, Unryuu reports that it's now 2300. Thank you very much for today.

331.1: I'm Amagi, an Unryuu-class Carrier. Thanks for your recruitment, Admiral. Amagi will concentrate!
331.25: I'm Amagi, 2nd Carrier of the Unryuu Class. My construction following the Rapid Naval Armaments Supplement Program. Even though I couldn't join the Mobile Striking Force, I did my best in the air raid at Kure Naval base.
331.3: What? Commencing anti-aircraft defense! Ara? Admiral? Um...well...
331.4: Admiral, what's wrong with Amagi's hangar? Deploying aircraft? Yes, I'm happy.
331.29: Hakodate... I wonder...? That's such a familiar name... Maybe it's just me...? Ah, Admiral! Did you call for me? Amagi will give her best!
331.28: Admiral,　good work as usual. Amagi's always on standby here, so... If you have any problems, just call me.
331.24: Admiral, did you call for Amagi? Huh? It's for Amagi? Then, I will accept it, Admiral. Th-thank you. I will treasure it.
331.8: Reports are important, right, Admiral? Amagi thinks so, too.
331.13: Amagi, flagship of the carrier squadron, sortieing!
331.9: Shall we reinforce my anti-aircraft guns?
331.10: Amagi is thankful for the new aircraft. Thank you very much.
331.27: Thank you, for all these precious fuel and aircraft.
331.11: It's not a serious wound but...thanks, Admiral.
331.12: I'm sorry. I'm going to take a lot of time in the bath. I'm truly sorry.
331.5: Looks like a new ship has joined the fleet.
331.7: The fleet has returned. Good work everyone.
331.15: It's not an AA defense! We're doing an air attack! Amagi, deploying aircraft!
331.18: What... A pursuit attack? Then... I'll do my best.
331.23: Amagi is...number one? Really? Thank you very much. I...I'm happy.
331.19: I got bombed!? Commence emergency procedures!
331.20: Hurry up with the flood control! I-I'm fine!
331.21: Uwa... I've been hit. It's impossible to launch planes now.
331.22: Even though...Amagi is sinking...Amagi still has this strange feeling... This time, I did my best...right...?
331.30: Admiral! The day has changed! Today, Amagi will announce the hourlies! Yes, don't worry! I'll do my best!
331.31: 01:00. Admiral... The fleet is quiet tonight!
331.32: 02:00. It's... Midnight... 'Are you scared'? No... I... am... not...? Admiral...? Where are you...? Hyaa!?
331.33: 03:00. Admiral? Um? Can you stop toying with me? Amagi was really surprised... It's not like I was scared...
331.34: 04:00. Admiral? It's very sleepy at this time... Ufu! I'm doing my best!
331.35: 05:00. It's dawn now... Shall we prepare for the reveille?
331.36: 06:00. Commencing reveille! It's morning! Let us give our best today, too!
331.37: 07:00. Admiral! I'm sorry for making such a simple dish but... breakfast is here! Today the soup for miso is...
331.38: 08:00. Admiral? Did Amagi's breakfast match your taste? Ah... great... I'll be cleaning now... Thanks...
331.39: 09:00. Admiral! It's about time we do some battles. What shall we pick for the main fleet?
331.40: 10:00. That's right... I'm happy I get to equip aircraft! They're beautiful... aircraft that is.
331.41: 11:00. It's about time for lunch, right? What do you want, Admiral...? I wonder what I should make...
331.42: 12:00. It's noon, now! Admiral, I tried making Japanese-style curry for lunch! Please eat up, I still have a lot left.
331.43: 13:00. My curry was good, too, right? Of course, the soup & the potato starch were on point, as well.
331.44: 14:00. Ah... Unryuu-neesama! How are you, today? You're getting more beautiful these days... Amagi want to be like you, too!
331.45: 15:00. Admiral, do you want some sweets? I've ordered some Kudzu starch cake from Mamiya! Let us dig in!
331.46: 16:00. Admiral, if Amagi trains hard, can Amagi match Hiryuu & Souryuu? Huh? Really...? Then, Amagi will do her best!
331.47: 17:00. Admiral, the sunset was beautiful, right...? Um... Amagi is also... Noooo, what am I saying... Let's go back... Yes...
331.48: 18:00. Admiral, shall Amagi prepare your dinner? Amagi will show you her culinary skills! Please wait!
331.49: 19:00. Amagi tried a Western-style dinner! It's cutlet & corn soup, today.
331.50: 20:00. Hah? 'Cutlet is different from tonkatsu'? Huh? 'How'? Well, first off... It's...
331.51: 21:00. Admiral! Yeah... About our sister Katsuragi? Yes, I believe we will meet again, & I want to form a carrier division with her.
331.52: 22:00. It's quiet at night... Well, looks like it's not... shall Amagi go & make it quiet?
331.53: 23:00. Admiral, thanks for your hard work today. Please have some sleep.

332.1: I'm Katsuragi, the third ship of the Unryuu-Class Carriers! Eh? 'A floating anti-air gun platform'? I-It's not like that...! What are you saying!
332.25: I'm Katsuragi, the third ship of the Unryuu-Class Carriers!  Yes, a standard aircraft carrier. Looks like I was late. But after the battle was over, I was working at full power. In a sense, I am the best. It's the truth! Really it's true!
332.2: I am a standard carrier. Got it?, a standard carrier!
332.3: Do you understand? Give me your best aircraft!
332.4: Wha... That's not my hanga... What are you doing anyway!? What do you want, you idiot!!
332.29: I see I see, so this is Ryuusei Kai. Yup yup. I've heard about it... wait isn't that one a Reppuu? That's wonderful! They're perfect for me! Eh!?
332.28: Admiral, hey, if only this aircraft was resupplied I would... Eh, what? Even if you look at me with such gentle eyes, nothing... it will gain you nothing! Geez~
332.24: What is it, Admiral? Can you see that I quite busy here, because this engine requires a lot of maintenance... what... this is... Thank you! I...
332.8: Yup. reporting in is extremely important! Shall we go together?
332.13: Aircraft carrier Katsuragi preparation complete! Ready for sortie!
332.9: T-That equipment is not too bad. Yup.
332.10: Yes, this'll help in the fight! I'm happy.
332.26: I'll give it all I've got!
332.27: Thanks for these valuable supplies. Yes, now I can head out again!
332.11: I'm going to the bath! You... don't you dare peek!
332.12: Eek... looks like this will take a while. Sorry, I'm going to the bath... I will kill you if you peek!
332.5: A new member has been added to the force! I'm curious!
332.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned. Well done everyone!
332.14: Carrier task force flagship, Katsuragi, launching! Whee... I've always wanted to say something like that!
332.15: Yes!!! Enemy fleet sighted! Launching strike aircraft!
332.16: Enemy spotted! All AA gun... Wait that's wrong, again from the top!!! Attack force, covering force, prepare to deploy!
332.18: Pursuing, huh? Going too far is restricted, but still sometimes needed... Alright, go!
332.23: Eh? Me? Katsuragi is number one? Really? Um... thanks...
332.19: No!? Is the flight deck ok? Prevent any secondary explosions! I... I don't want to sink!
332.20: I, Katsuragi, can not sink at such place! Such attacks...!
332.21: I was hit... But the engine room is still undamaged! Can operate without problems!
332.22: I see, this is sinking... cold... and lonely... bye-bye, everyone...
332.30: Um...Today I, standard carrier Katsuragi, will be your secretary. What? Got a problem? I have enough time to do time announcement at least, enough time!
332.31: 1:00 AM Is that okay? Are you listening? I see...then its fine! Alright!
332.32: Its 2:00 AM...Hey...You aren't listening to my announcements! I see...really? Then, that's okay.
332.33: 3:00 AM... See! You clearly didn't listen! Just what were you doing? ...huh, cooking?
332.34: It's 4:00 AM... What? Night meal for me? That's hot pot with udon... well, thank you. It's delicious but... why?
332.35: 5:00... Huh? Compared with my sister, the part that needs to stick out do not stick out, so I have to eat...? Y-You have done it! Any last word!?
332.36: It's 6:00 AM. Hah... just what were you looking at when you are looking at us shipgirls? That place is irrelevant with our ability to perform... good grief...!
332.37: It's 7:00 AM! I got mad at someone and get hungry as a result! You, you need to make breakfast... Isn't that right as a punishment? Yup punishment!
332.38: It's 8:00! No way, your breakfast is... delicious! Where did you learn?... Eh... Amagi-nee? R-Really?
332.39: It's 9:00. I really don't want to... But, a carrier's ability is not limited to her cooking! After all, a carrier is all about...
332.40: It's 10:00 AM! Ah! Zuikaku-senpai! Good work as always!... ah, I was nervous! Well it was Zuikaku-san, the one I admire!
332.41: 11:00 AM. Eh? What, it's true though! After all it's Zuikaku-san, the one I'm admiring! Isn't that wonderful...! I also like her camouflage, mine also matches hers!
332.42: 12:00 PM. Ah! It's already lunchtime!? What are you doing for lunch? Going to Mamiya's or...unnn...
332.43: 13:00 PM. Sometime it's good to go outside the harbor. You get a little of this disembark feeling... Ah! I-It's not like we're on a date or anything!
332.44: It's 14:00 AM. It's not what you think! You're such an idiot... but that Western-style shop is really good... I wouldn't mind going there again.
332.45: It's 15:00 PM! Ah, is Amagi-nee okay? Yup, I'm always perfect! Look! My maintenance is perfect, from my rocket launcher to the flight deck!
332.46: It's 16:00 PM! Eh? What? AA defense? That's my special of special trick! What? Show it right here? It's very flashy, you'll see!
332.47: 17:00 PM. It's already evening, after all that trick... Hah, I can't do any sortie or expedition...B-But I'll do it tomorrow!
332.48: 18:00 PM. Evening already... well... If it's okay I'll do something simple! Rice ball with salt, pickled raikon radish... wait, green leaves with miso soup is alright, right?
332.49: It's 19:00 PM. So? Is my riceball with sal... riceball seasoned with salt delicious? Of course, the level will only increase after this!
332.50: 20:00. W-well sometime, I want to to go out as the main ship of the combined fleet... really.
332.51: 21:00. So, what is your dream like? Isn't it fine, just tell me! Eh? Really? Ehh... Uhm... So it's like that...
332.52: It's 22:00 PM. *humming* Eh? I'm not in a good mood, not such thing! I'm fine! I-am-fine! Ehehe
332.53: 23:00. Finally, today was perfect! Good work from you too! Tomorrow will come soon, so how about a little rest? Huh? You're not gonna?

326.1: We are Hatsuharu. With us following, thou wilt be fine!
326.25: We are the 1st Hatsuharu-class destroyer, Hatsuharu. We were attached to the Northern Force. As the clouds of war gathers, we did our duty in the Northern seas at such places as Attu and Kiska. The seas around Hokkaido are our favourite, no? The Gulf of Manila and Ormoc... ah, we are weak to the heat.
326.2: Oh, are you interested in us?
326.3: Yes, this is how you should be treating us.
326.4: You really can't calm down, can you?... Why is that? Dost thou take such interest in us?
326.29: Aah, well, you know, it would be all right if we did some work... it would be all right, you know?
326.28: You should... rest a little better as well. Of course, we can rest when it's important. ...It's pleasant!
326.24: You...!? W-w-w-w-aaa! To expose us to such shameful words! Shame on you! For shame...
326.8: That's right, information is important. Good good. There is a lot to inquire from this.
326.9: Yes. We became stronger once more.
326.10: Did you not say that the equipment up to now was not quite up to par?
326.27: We are grateful... no hardships in this.
326.11: Phew... this bath is nice. As I thought, cypress-tree baths are supreme.
326.12: This arsenal has such skilled craftsman, we are unperturbed.
326.6: Good grief.. Are the repairs finally finished?
326.5: A new ship is complete, perchance?
326.7: It appears that the fleet has returned. Surely, a triumph?
326.15: Thou wishest to see our dance? Very well... we shall show thee plenty!
326.18: At long last... we shall demonstrate our true purpose!
326.23: This triumph, it was not solely due to our efforts. Everyone did their part.
326.20: Verily, thou shalt experience our wrath!
326.21: 'Tis but a scratch! We shall not sink from just this!

405.1: Fifth Shiratsuyu-class destroyer, Harusame, yes. Leave the transport missions to me... desu.
405.25: Fifth Shiratsuyu-class destroyer, Harusame. Delicious... wait! that's a different kind of Harusame! With Murasame and big sis Yuudachi we cruised the sea as Destroyer Division 2! I'm a bit good at transport and guarding mission, yes!
405.2: Did you have business... with me?
405.3: Commander, um... I have another transport mission, so... Excuse me.
405.4: Hyah! ...C-Commander!? Um... The supplies are fine, they're fine so...
405.29: Commander? ...Um, commander? ...I wonder if he's busy? ...Yeah, I have to do my best too!
405.28: Um, I can't really say it well, but... I'm always grateful. Truly.
405.24: Commander... U-um, what is it? Is it a new transport mission? Eh, it's not? Then night battle duty? That's not it either? Eh... for me... Fufu, I'll treasure it.
405.8: A business message is... um... Please look.
405.9: With this... transport missions will progress.
405.10: With this, I'll be able to guard well too...
405.11: Yes, I think I'll take a bath.
405.12: I've gotten a bit tired... yes.
405.6: Repairs, seems like it has to be done, okay.
405.5: A new ship has, yes, been completed.
405.7: Mission complete. Fleet returning to base, yes.
405.18: Allow me to start the night battle.
405.23: I was the best... really? Really? ...Yes, I'm a little bit happy.
405.21: T-they got me... I can still continue my guard duties.
405.22: I guess... that's... it... Murasame-neesan... This time, I'll go on ahead...
405.30: It's 0000. Uhm, it's a new day.
405.32: 0200. It's the dead of the night. I'm a little... No! I'm not scared at all.
405.33: 0300. Wah...! Uuu, I'm sorry. I'll be careful from now on.
405.34: 0400. Hey, I'm feeling kind of... I-It's alright! I'm not sleepy, yes!
405.35: 0500. Commander, it's the start of the day. Good morning.
405.36: 0600. Is it alright if Harusame makes breakfast? Right! Let's do it.
405.37: 0700. And for breakfast it's Mapo Haru... I'm kidding. I made a Japanese set meal. Please help yourself to it.
405.38: 0800. Let's work hard for today's transport mission. Transporting and escorting are important.
405.39: 0900. I wonder if Murasame-nee-san is doing well... Hmm...
405.40: 1000. For lunch... Ah, it's still to early for lunch right now. I apologise.
405.41: 1100. Commander, what are you having for lunch? It's not so bad to eat out once in awhile. Uh... Uhm...
405.42: 1200. Eh, it's alright for me to accompany the Commander out for lunch? I'm so happy.
405.43: 1300. It was fun at the western restaurant. I'm glad to have gone, yes.
405.44: 1400. Huh? What's Yuudachi-nee-san doing at such a place? Isn't it dangerous?
405.45: 1500. Commander, uh, uhm... Should I bring along some snacks?
405.46: 1600. The skies are getting darker. It's almost evening, yes.
405.47: 1700. Commander, the sunset is beautiful, isn't it? I feel like I could stare at it forever.
405.48: 1800. I'll prepare dinner. Commander, what do you feel like having?
405.49: 1900. I've gone and done it. Harusame's special Mapo Harusame. T-Try it!
405.50: 2000. How was dinner? The secret ingredients were sesame oil and five-spice powder.
405.51: 2100. Commander, I'll be washing all this dishes up first. Excuse me.
405.52: 2200. Commander, it's about time we made plans for tomorrow's transport mission. Uhm...
405.53: 2300. Oh, uhm, Commander, thanks for the hard work today.

406.1: Unryuu class aircraft carrier, Unryuu is here. Admiral, please leave the future of the task force to me.
406.25: I am the elder sister of the Unryuu class aircraft carriers built under the Rapid Naval Armaments Supplement Programme during wartime. We are the improved mass-production version of the medium-sized carrier masterpiece, Hiryuu. I'll show you the immense potential of the main force of the reborn Mobile Task Force.
406.3: I'm telling you, stop touching my flight deck! Are you really that curious? It can't be helped.
406.4: Hnn...so you'll give me even more outstanding planes? I wonder if you can give me different plane types as well.
406.29: Admiral?.....admiral? Can you hear me? Should I send a recon plane? Or maybe a dive bomber?
406.28: Admiral, though the battle this time is unavoidable, ease your shoulders and relax a little bit. I'll always be beside you... So it's okay.
406.24: Admiral, what's this formality? Eh, is this for me? It can't be...um...why me? There are others that still...no, I'll treasure it. It's important.
406.8: Information? Let me have a look... Hmm, I see.
406.13: Task force flagship aircraft carrier Unryuu, deploying.
406.9: New planes really boosts morale, huh.
406.10: Ryuusei Kai, huh...? Ah, um, nothing.
406.27: Resupply eh...Please refill my aircraft too.
406.11: My clothes have become dirty. Quite unpleasant....
406.12: Taking a bath after battle... Whew.. I'll just take a breath and rest for the moment.
406.6: Repair is finished. The dry docks are busy after all.
406.5: It seems a hastily-built ship is complete. Is she Amagi?
406.14: Unryuu class transport ship, they say? What a joke. I shall show you my true power.
406.16: I can go? Okay, all aircraft, launch now.
406.23: Unryuu is the most valuable ship? I see...Hnn, I'm happy, it feels good....
406.20: A direct hit!? Engine room! Deploy the power reserves!
406.21: Got hit...must recover from listing... This time... I won't sink...!
406.22: An explosion from the hangar...no good...well...it's fine...this time it was able to work as intended...thank you...
406.31: Admiral, it's now 0100. I don't dislike the stillness of the late night.
406.32: 0200. Admiral, it would be better to take a rest now.
406.33: 0300. Admiral, I... have a feeling someday I will meet Amagi as well.
406.34: 0400. Admiral, it will be dawn soon. Another day will begin.
406.35: 0500. Admiral, it is now morning. Now, let's begin operations.
406.36: 0600. Admiral, what would be good for breakfast? Are you all right if it's the same as mine?
406.37: 0700. I'm sorry for the one-plate meal. Is the amount a little lacking?
406.38: 0800. Now, Admiral, let's bring the carrier-based planes aboard, and dispatch the fleet.
406.39: 0900. What would be good for carrier-based aircraft? Tenzan... ? Ryuusei...? Reppuus are fine too.
406.40: 1000. Admiral, the currently loaded airframes are quite... Um, uh...
406.41: 1100. Admiral, what would be good for lunch? I shall prepare it.
406.42: 1200. I made onigiri for lunchtime combat rations. How is it?
406.43: 1300. Admiral, was the lunch a bit too simple? I'm sorry...
406.44: 1400. Admiral, of course I don't mind the transport missions, but the cargo... err....
406.45: 1500. I see. But carrying such highly volatile cargo is somewhat... yes...
406.46: 1600. Admiral, I'm feeling nervous in this hour. As I thought, one should be more alert to the presence of submarines.
406.47: 1700. Phew... it's a relief once we get past this hour. I was a little nervous.
406.48: 1800. Admiral, it's time for dinner. What would you like? Er...
406.49: 1900. What's the matter, Shigure? Eh, provisions? Thank you, you saved me.
406.50: 2000. Admiral, Shigure has brought us provisions of onigiri and pickled daikon radish.
406.51: 2100. Admiral, we have already had it for lunch. But Shigure's onigiri is delicious, isn't it? Ufufu.
406.52: Now is 2200, Admiral. It's completely night & becoming much quieter now.
406.53: Admiral, Unryuu reports that it's now 2300. Thank you very much for today.

407.1: I'm Special-type Destroyer... Ayanami-class 'Ushio'. It would be nice to be dismissed soon...
407.25: I'm the 10th of the Ayanami-class, Ushio. I survived the Battle of Leyte Gulf and many other fierce battles. After that fateful day at Leyte, I fought on dutifully till the end of the war at Yokosuka. U-um...to all the enemy ships that that were sunk... I really wanted to spare you. Really!
407.3: It'd be nice if we could avoid air raids even a little. Admiral, would you like to put on some of this coating too?
407.4: Mutsu-san......? Oh, Admiral? I'm sorry, I must have been mistaken.
407.29: Admiral, um... Ushio, awaiting orders... Er, I wonder if I'm a being a hindrance...? Au...... Um, um!
407.28: Admiral. For always watching over me earlier than Shoukaku-san, and more warmly than Mutsu-san, I'm...I'm always really sorry!
407.24: Admiral, I adore... No, wait... respect you! Yes! Always!
407.8: Analyzing the record? Ushio will keep hold of it.
407.10: It would be good... if I could just be a bit more self confident... I think...
407.26: I'll help everyone if I can!
407.27: This... this is modernization...no, wait I mean resupply, yes resupply. I am most grateful.
407.12: Repair teams... erm... please take care of me...
407.7: The fleet has returned safely. I'm really glad!
407.14: It's a sortie, isn't it... I have to do it!
407.18: You are not allowed to hurt my comrades!
407.23: I... was helpful?.. Ah... don't stare, everybody... It's embarrassing...
407.22: I wonder... Did Ushio... protect everyone...?

408.1: Ex-merchant ship aircraft carrier, Junyo~! Woohoo!
408.25: Wartime remodeling based on the Luxury liner, Kashiwara Maru. The renovated appearance is the aircraft carrier, Jun'you. I fought properly, and survived until the end. Ain't I surprisingly capable ?
408.2: Aaaadmiral~. If you're free, come help out~. Hiyou an' me, we need some planes built, ya know?
408.3: Hiyahh~! A drink after battle is especially great, isn't it? I can see the Admiral as two people~! Ahahaha!
408.4: Oohh~, that's a long face, Admiral. That's no good! Drink some of this! Here, here.
408.29: Ahh man, I'm bored. Oh well, I'll drink! Let's see... maybe I'll have hot sake...
408.28: Yo~ Admiral, shouldn't we have a drink together some time? I got some really good sake. Ah, don't worry I have snacks too.
408.24: I'm worked hard so that I wouldn't lose to those aircraft carriers. You're the only Admiral that gets that, you know. Hey, gimme a kiss~.
408.8: That's right. Once in awhile, information management doesn't sound bad. How was it, hmmm?
408.13: Nice! Fully remodeled Jun'you is ready to sortie! Set sail!
408.10: S-so cool! I'm gonna fall in love with myself~!
408.27: Much obliged. And don't forget to supply the canteen either. It's important!
408.11: Phew~! Dunkin' in hot bath stings my wound. Say, is it possible to bring sake in here?
408.12: Dang, my armour's gettin' a bit thin. With me and Hiyou, there's no helping it.
408.6: Repairs are finally over!. Let's celebrate my recovery!
408.5: A new friend has come. Let's have a party.
408.7: The fleet's come back. Good work.
408.14: With me an' Hiyou here, well, we're a Task force, yeah? Yeah!
408.15: Let's go all out! All out!
408.16: Heheh. I'm gonna strike with all my force! Eat this!
408.23: Wha? Man, I really did it, didn't I? Carrier-based planes really are the best. Hehe.
408.20: Told ya' my armour was thin. Really!
408.22: H-hey, hey now, I'm sinking? Really?

409.1: I've... come again, to these seas. Yuugumo-class destroyer, Hayashimo... reporting for duty.
409.25: I'm the 17th of the Yuugumo-class Destroyer, Hayashimo. I was born in the Maizuru Naval Base Factory, to times of impending troubles. I launched for the Battle of Leyte Gulf from the Lingga Naval Anchorage... And I've seen many things.
409.3: Heh... Yeah. This scenery hasn't changed.
409.4: Commander? To care about me, you're really kind.
409.29: Just like this... I'm always watching. Watching... always... forever.
409.28: Commander. I think you're working a bit too much too. Umm... Sometimes, together, we should... Uu... I-it's nothing... Uu
409.24: Commander, meeting you, I... I'm glad. So, just this is enough... eh? This is... truly? I... can I change, I wonder?
409.8: Commander, you'll look at the data? I see...
409.9: Stronger... Will something change if I get stronger?
409.27: Thank you very much. You have my gratitude.
409.6: The repair... right... Repair is repair.
409.5: More battle strength is needed... again... they increased.
409.7: The fleet returned. Fu...Fufufu. They returned.
409.14: Victory strategy number one? Oh, it's not huh.
409.15: You want to go at it with me? Fine, I'll be your opponent.
409.18: Night, huh... Fufu, let's jump right in.
409.23: You're giving someone like me your blessing? Commander, you're a good person. Fufu... Ufufu.
409.20: Ouch... what... this time it's my chimney?
409.21: Like this, it can't be helped. Isn't there a good sandbar around?
409.22: Right in front of me... everyone is... what should I do. Wait... wait... I'm going too.
409.32: 0200. We have an enjoyable time at night, too. I've watered it down (the sake), let's keep having fun!
409.33: 0300. Pulling an all-nighter will harm your body, commander. Rest for awhile.
409.34: 0400. The blue of the morning sky. I don't hate it, but it's a little cold right now.
409.35: 0500. I'm sorry, was my hand cold to the touch?
409.36: 0600. Let's wake everyone up and get ready for the day.
409.37: 0700. The morning checks have been done... Let's look for Mamiya-san... And have our breakfast.
409.38: 0800. Commander, here's the mission file for the day. Let's start by looking at it closely.

409.52: 2200. Ah, Nachi-san brought the whiskey bottle. Will you drink some?

78.1: It's the English-born returnee, Kongou! Nice to meet you!

78.10: It feels like I've finally became my true self!
78.27: Yes! I will show you what I'm made of!

78.22: Admiral... May your fortunes hold... I'll... be watching from Valhalla...

78.32: Two... a..m... Just when are you working 'till... zzz...
78.33: Three... a..m... I'm just sleeping now...
78.34: Four... a..m... The admiral is here too... zzz... Admiral?

78.39: It's 9 A.M. I tasted Japanese breakfast!
78.40: Ten o'clock! Morning work, come on!
78.41: Eleven~! Hey, Admiral~... Just looking at you never gets old!

78.44: 2 P.M. It's almost tea time! I've got scones waiting for you!
78.45: 3 P.M. Tea time with the Admiral! Mmmmm, black tea is delicious♪
78.46: 4 P.M. HEY Admiral~ How about having one of my hand-made scones?
78.47: Evening, five o'clock. My feelings for Admiral won't lose to anyone else's!
78.48: 6 P.M., I'll be making English-style curry for the Admiral tonight!
78.49: A time signal? I'm making soup right now. Please don't talk to me.
78.50: It's 8 P.M. HEY! ADMIRAL! Kongou's English-style curry is done! Eat up!
78.51: 9 P.M. There are no ingredients in curry? No problem♪ Its all mixed together!
78.52: It's 10 P.M! Admiral~ Another day of hard work! Let's do our best together tomorrow too!
78.53: It's almost 'good night' time! I'll be Admiral's time keeper tomorrow too!

410.1: Hello! Last of the Yuugumo-class, it's Kiyoshimo! I'm a bit late, but I'll be in your care!

I wasn't around for long but I took part in several fleet actions. Leyte was, of course, apalling to see but I even took part in Operation Rei-gou! How's that?

410.28: Commander? You know, if you're tired, you can take a break with me? Right, right?
410.24: Commander? What's wrong, you have such a serious look on your face? Eh, what's... this? This is for me? Really? Nn... thank you. I wonder... why... I'm starting to tear up.
410.8: Commander? Want to see the message? Hm?
410.9: I wonder how many more remodels will it take for me to become a battleship...? Eh? O-of course I can!

410.11: I wish I sortie with battleshi~ps!
410.12: I'll be in the bath for sliiiightly longer. Yup.

410.18: A night deployment, huh... I ended up remembering that night.
410.17: I said I'd protect you this time, didn't I?
410.23: Hmhmm, how's that? Now you've seen what I can really do. You want to go ahead and remodel me into a battleship now?

410.21: Huh? The left side? Huh? Navigation is impossible? No way... That's... Really bad isn't it...?
410.22: Am I... going to sink... again? It's fine... Everyone, go on ahead... Once you hit the enemy... come back, ok?
410.30: 00000! Eh? Was there an extra 0? 0000-... H-huh? Huh? Huuuh?
410.32: 0222! Wah, I messed up again. I'll get it this time! It's 0200!
410.33: 03! ...00... I'm sleepy... This mission, is tough...
410.34: 0400. I'm seriously sleepy right now! Won't someone take over already?!
410.35: 0500! Eh? If I do this right, I'll become a battleship? Guh... I guess I'll do my best.

410.38: 0800. How is breakfast? Let's eat our fill and turn into battleships together!

410.40: 1000. Ugh... I ate too much for breakfast... And it feels bad after I've exercised... Uuu...
410.41: I don't feel so good... 11..0..0... S-Somehow I managed to report the time. Guh...

410.43: 1300. What did you have for lunch? Omurice with Yamato-nee-sama? H-how nice...
410.44: 1400. Eh, Kasumi-chan? What's wrong, you're here because you're worried about me again?
410.45: 1500. I got a riceball from Kasumi-chan because I didn't have lunch! Let's have it now. Mmm, this flavor of salt from the salted plum is great.
410.46: 1600. Commander, this Kiyoshimo has mended her ways. Let's do it!
410.47: 1700. Right, I should get to cleaning the office and prepare for outfitting!
410.48: 1800. Commander? There's night battle training for the day? Of course! I'll join too!
410.49: 1900. Right! For this part, I should use the star flare, star flares... Huh? I don't have one?
410.50: 2000. Really, the members 2nd Torpedo Squadron were strong. How nice...

412.3: Sister?! Oh, it's just the Admiral.
412.4: The Admiral, too... Please take a break sometime.

412.9: Is really okay to get this before onee-sama?
412.10: Modernization... They can't call me a 'faulty battleship' now...

412.21: No way, torpedoes? ...Remaining ships, please proceed! Annihilate the enemy~!

413.1: Asashio-class destroyer, Asagumo, reporting in! So you're the Commander... huh. Hmm. Well, it's fine. I'll do it!
413.25: Asashio-class destroyer number 5, Asagumo. Together with my sworn friend Yamagumo, we made it through many battlefields. That's right, the 9th DesDiv. Famous, right? Eh, you haven't heard of us? You know, I don't really like jokes. Remember that!

413.28: Commander...Its good that you're working hard, but if you overdo things, it makes me worried, seriously! Yes, make sure you rest appropriately...got it?
413.24: What, Commander? I'm pretty busy here... Heh, what? Another joke. ...Eh, you're serious? Ah, what do I do... Y-Yamagumo is... Ehh, umm...

413.10: My, is it alright? Yeah, yeah.

413.16: Don't mess with DesDiv 9! We can do it, keep moving forward!
413.18: Night battle, huh. Yep, let's do this!
413.23: See, isn't it me? I won't lose to the likes of the Kagerou-class. Obviously!
413.20: Tch... That hurts, you know! Quit it!
413.21: I...I've been beaten...but, I can still navigate..! As if I'll sink!
413.22: ...Fufu, Yamagumo... We're together again. It's not like I'm... like I'm lonely, you know...
413.30: Commander! It's gotten pretty late... I'll keep you company for today. It just became midnight, after all!
413.31: It's 0100! The night's a bit cold...
413.32: It's 0200...? What's with that face...? I'm not particularly sleepy or anything. you know?
413.33: It's 0300...? Commander... are you feeling drowsy? You have terrible bags under your eyes... Are you not getting enough sleep? Its fine if you have a nap, I'll be on night watch from here on.
413.34: Its 0400, huh... These early morning hours are cold... I don't hate it, though... What do you think, Commander... oh you fell asleep...?
413.35: It's 0500! Commander! Get up! We have to go wake everyone up soon! Hey, are you listening?
413.36: It's become 0600! Everyone, raise up! Okay? ...Commander? Are you even awake?
413.37: It's 0700! Breakfast time... bread is fine, isn't it? Toast? Aren't you demanding...here you go.
413.38: 0800... I'll take care of the plates, pass them here. Ah, the jam on the toast was good, wasn't it? Yamagumo gave it to me!
413.39: Its 0900. Its about time for the fleet to seriously start running...please use us destroyers well, too! Commander? Are you listening?
413.40: Its 1000 huh... Are the expeditions okay? Our tasks are progressing at a good rate...all thats left is...uh, commander? What are you doing? Hey?
413.41: Its 1100. Can I have lunch with Yamagumo? I promised her. Ah, she's not a bad girl, really! I guarantee it!
413.42: Its 1200 right? Commander, this is my best friend Yamagumo. She's a little weird, but please look after her! Uhh... Yamagumo, where are you going? Hey!
413.43: 1300. Commander, sorry...it seems like she had something on her mind...I'll ask her about it later! Sorry...how strange though...
413.44: Its 1400 now. As an apology for not eating lunch with you, I bought this at the canteen. We can eat this together...or rather, I'll give it to you, okay?
413.45: Its 1500 huh...Ah! It's Kirishima-san! Welcome back! Yes, Asagumo has been doing well! Yes!
413.46: Its 1600 now. Eh, my attitude towards Kirishima-san is different? Of course, that person is amazing! After all, I saw it! Mmm, I saw it!
413.47: 1700. It's about time to prepare dinner. Ah don't worry, I'll prepare it! I said I'll do it, don't worry about it!
413.48: Its 1800 now. Okay, dinner is served! Eh, you're complaining about the barley rice? What are you talking about, this is the basis of the dish! It's also very nutritious!
413.49: 1900. Hm? But the yellowtail teriyaki was delicious? I know right? It goes will with barley and rice, doesn't it?
413.50: It's become 2000. The night...the night is not my strong point. Ah, don't worry, I'm fine....now...
413.51: Its 2100 now. Oh, Yamagumo? What is it? No no, thats wrong! That's absolutely wrong! Jeez!
413.52: 2200. Yamagumo has some kind of misunderstanding...sometimes she goes into la-la land with her thoughts. She's usually pretty normal though...
413.53: Its 2300, huh...its completely nighttime now. The naval base is...not very quiet though. Yeah, I'll have to go give a warning.

414.1: Good morning~~. Asashio Destroyer number six, Yamagumo. Please treat me well!
414.25: I'm the sixth Asashio-class destroyer, Yamagumo~ I was born in Osaka and raised in Yokosuka~ Uh-huh, I'll have to watch out for sea mines~ I was active in escort and patrol missions, then deployed to the Marianas and also Leyte Gulf as part of the Nishimura fleet~

414.4: U~m~, sorry. If you're too pushy, I'll seriously get angry, you know?
414.29: U~m~ Yamagumo kind of likes having free time~ But Asagumo-nee~ she's an impatient person~ you know~?
414.28: Commander, you're working so hard~ How admirable~ Yamagumo thinks that you're really quite amazing~ Yes, really!
414.24: Commander, what is it? Are you giving this box to Yamagumo? I wonder what it is? Ooh, pretty~ Thank you~
414.8: Information, I see. That's really important, isn't it?
414.10: How is it~? Does it suit Yamagumo~? Really~?
414.11: I guess a bath is nice too~
414.12: Uh, I'm sorry~ I'll take it easy with a bath~
414.6: A girl have just came out of the bath~
414.7: The fleet has returned~. Oh, that's good~, isn't it?
414.14: Oh, Asagumo-nee? Do you want to go together?
414.16: Uh-huh~ I want to hit as much as possible~
414.18: Night battles~ Yamagumo might just be a li~ttle bit bad at them~
414.23: Huh~ Yamagumo was the best~? Oh, I guess that could happen~ That's interesting~
414.20: No~ Yamagumo is weak against attacks~!
414.21: I guess I need to get a bi~t more serious.
414.22: I'm sinking, huh... Asagumo-nee... don't come... okay?... See you... later...
414.30: Commander~ Yamagumo is today's secretary huh...sure, I'll do it!
414.31: 01...00! Am I doing it right? Is that so?
414.32: 02...00! Midnight's over~ For some reason, I feel pretty nervous around this time...
414.33: 03...00! Around this time, I start to feel strange...fuu~

414.36: 06..00! It's daytime! We'll need to wake everyone up! I like the morning.

414.38: 08...00! Isn't egg mixed with rice tasty? It's also tasty with brown rice...Yamagumo likes it too!
414.39: 09...00! Oh right, during today's lunch, I'm going with Asagumo on a date! A date...isn't that nice? I'm looking forward to it!
414.40: 10...00! Asagumo is a soft person...that's why I like her!
414.41: 11...00! Commander, how do I look? I look fine? Alright, I'm heading out!
414.42: 12...00! Is that...Fusou and Yamashiro? Uuh, for some reason, my stomach is starting to hurt...uuh, guess I'll go home...
414.43: 13...00! Commander, I am fine now! I made a U-turn and came back~ I'll return to work now~
414.44: 14...00! All members of the expedition team are accounted for! Mission progress is okay! Commander, the fleet is doing well~
414.45: 15...00! Ah, these? They are vegetables I grew from my own garden! I was taught how to do that in Rabaul~
414.46: 16...00! If you boil these vegetables, add a lot of sugar and make it into a jam, its surprisingly tasty! See?
414.47: 1700! Before you know it, its already evening....the day sure goes quickly~
414.48: 18...00! Yamagumo will be making dinner tonight! I'll be making a curry using my home grown vegetables! It's delicious!
414.49: 1900! Yamagumo's home grown vegetable curry was good right? Hm? Who did I grow these vegetables with? I did it with Asagumo!
414.50: 20..00! After this, I'm going on a date with Asagumo again, I can't wait! My tie isn't crooked right? I feel nervous~
414.51: 21...00! I'm heading off! Asagumo...! Huh...who is....that? They look....close....Huh...? Tears are...falling out of my....huh?
414.52: 22...00....Commander...Asagumo is with an unknown guy...um...eh? That's not right? Is that what it is? Oh, is that all~
414.53: 2300! What a relief...Asagumo is working huh~ Commander, Yamagumo is relieved...I felt so tense...

415.1: Kagerou-class Destroyer, Nowaki, reporting in. Well, Commander. Let us proceed.
415.25: Kagerou-class destroyer number 15, Nowaki. Born in Maizuru. I was with Maikaze in the 4th DesDiv. At the start of the war, I participated in the Southern Operation in the 4th Torpedo Squadron under Naka-san, as well as Midway, Mariana, and Leyte. I will do my best with whatever I can.
415.3: Hm? Commander, do you have a request?
415.4: Maikaze, stop it... Commander? ...What is the meaning of this?

415.28: Commander, are you perhaps tired?... don't overwork yourself, please, take a rest.
415.24: Commander, what is it? Maikaze is waiting so I have to go back... eh?... this is... uhm... I have to report to Naka-san... eh?... it is not needed?
415.9: This is good... With this, I feel like I can keep going.

415.39: 0900. Soon, our Fourth Destroyer Squadron will sortie in full force as well. Commander, your orders!
415.40: 1000. Maikaze, dancing around all the time like that is dangerous... Ah, Commander, I'm sorry!
415.41: 1100. Commander, it will be noon soon. What will you have? Nowaki will follow your orders.
415.42: 1200... Ah, Akagi-san. And to what do we owe the plea- Eh? Lunch? Y, yes! Help yourself!
415.43: 1300. That surprised me back then. Excuse me... No, I'm fine.
415.44: 1400. Well, let's do our best with the afternoon's missions too. Commander, what's next?
415.45: 1500. Maikaze, I'm sorry, I'm working right now... Haah, it can't be helped... Jeez.
415.46: 1600. Commander, excuse me. I'll be fine. It won't have any effect on the fleet's duties.

416.25: Heavy cruiser, Furutaka. Selected by Vice Admiral Mikawa to be a member of the 8th fleet, I took out a lot of enemies at the 1st Battle of Solomon! This is what a heavy cruiser can do!

421.52: 2200. Ah, Shoukaku-san, Zuikaku-san. Good work. Yes, I'm alright!

430.21: I was hit... But the engine room is still undamaged! Can operate without problems!
430.22: I see, this is sinking... cold... and lonely... bye-bye, everyone...

430.31: 1:00 AM Is that okay? Are you listening? I see...then its fine! Alright!
430.32: Its 2:00 AM...Hey...You aren't listening to my announcements! I see...really? Then, that's okay.

It seems that the technology of the Japanese carrier, Akagi, was also referenced in my construction. A Japanese fleet, huh. I'm looking forward to it.

I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series. I was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. 17.25: Constucted for the Circle-4 programe, Kagerou-class nameship, Kagerou. As the main power of the newly-made ships, staring off with the Hawaii attack force, I was in lots of varied battles! Treat me well!
17.4: I'll get angry if you touch me too much, you know?
17.29: Commander, are you listening? Commander? Oh, come on, Commander! What's the big idea, ignoring me?!
17.24: Ah, Commander! Great work!... Erm, right.. Um, here's a Hawaiian souvenir chocolate for you!
17.8: A telegram for the commander has arrived.
17.9: Thanks! Expect great things from me!
17.10: Oh? This is pretty good! Thanks.
17.27: Thanks! Expect great things from me!
17.12: I'll be away for a bit. *sigh*.
17.6: Looks like a new friend has just finished repairs.
17.14: Both turbines to full speed, Kagerou sortieing!
17.17: How bad for you, take this!
17.23: How was it, my fighting? A text-book case? Ah, thanking me is enough.
17.20: Hmmph, it'll take more than that!
17.21: I'm not worth of the position of the Kagerou nameship... *sigh*

18.1: I'm Shiranui. I look forward to your guidance and encouragement.
18.25: Second Kagerou-class destroyer, Shiranui. Along with the other Kageros I served as the escort for the Hawaii Operational Forces. In the fated Battle of Leyte Gulf, I was attached to Shima's fleet and rushed to the Surigao Strait.
18.2: What is it... did I make a mistake?
18.3: Do you have something for me to do?
18.4: Did you call for me, commander?
18.29: Shiranui is absolutely not bored. No, please don't mind me. Do as you like...
18.24: Commander, what do you think of my battles...? Oh, I see... Well, that's fine too.
18.9: Oh. Good upgrade. I appreciate it.
18.27: Oh. Good supplies. I appreciate it.
18.11: Though I can still sail... but if it's an order...
18.12: I wont just sit here and accept this.
18.6: A ship has been fully repaired.
18.5: It appears a new ship is complete.
18.14: I will live up to your expectations.
18.18: I will chase them down completely.
18.23: I'm bored. Is there no more spirited foe?
18.19: This level of damage won't sink me.
18.22: If this is death, everyone is coming with me... That includes you.

19.25: Built in the Osaka Civilian Naval Yards, 3rd of the Kagerou-class Destroyers, Kuroshio. Even though I look like this, I participated in such hard-fought battles as Surabaya, the South Pacific and the third Battle of Solomon, ya' know.
19.4: Hey, there's nothing wrong with my body, y'know?
19.29: Chief? Chieeef? Can yoouu heeeear me? ...Oh well. Guess I'll just take it easy then.
19.24: I... I'm... always lookin' at the chief, y'know? Really! C'mon, believe me...
19.13: Well then, Kuroshio, off I go!
19.11: I'm just gonna rest for a bit~
19.12: Oww... I can't really bear this level of pain...
19.6: The ship repair has been finished?
19.15: Well now, let's get this party started!
19.23: It just kind of happened that way, don't worry about me.
19.22: I… I can't live any longer… Goodbye…

74.1: I'm the light aircraft carrier, Shouhou. Yes, I'm a little small, but please make a place for me on your fleet!
74.25: First of the Shouhou-class aircraft carriers. Originally, a submarine tender. If it's not the flagship or the main fleet but a small task-force, then by all means use me! If you make use of me, I'll surely get good results!
74.3: Eh, do I like coral? No, I hate it!
74.4: Um...if you touch me too much, I can't launch my aircraft. Can we do it after I've launched everything?
74.29: One dive bomber... two dive bombers... three... Ah, Admiral! It's okay, I'm not lonely or anything. I have my planes with me and... Ah, yes!
74.28: Once in a while, won't you try taking it easy and be yourself? Forget about things like sortie and your duty... I mean, I'm sorry! That's no good, isn't it...
74.24: Admiral, am I being useful? Really? Then...that's great. From now on, I'll always be by your side!
74.8: Admiral, you have a message from command.
74.9: Huh? I'm so happy! For you to be giving me strength!
74.10: Thank you! Now, I'll be able to keep up with the fleet carriers!
74.27: Huh? Huh? I'm so happy! For you to be giving me strength! Supplies, much appreciated.
74.11: Time for a little rest. I'll be well shortly.
74.12: If I stay like this, I'll just be a target for the enemy. I'm sorry, but I need to rest a little.
74.6: Thank you for waiting! Ship's repairs have been completed.
74.5: Looks like a new ship has arrived.
74.7: A fleet has just returned to port from an operation.
74.14: Will my planes be okay...? No, it'll be fine!
74.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Bombers, please prepare for flight!
74.16: I'm still an aircraft carrier! I can do it!
74.18: Second attack squadron, are you ready? Then, prepare for launch!
74.23: Yay, I did it! I'm so happy! From now on, I'll be sure to keep working hard!
74.21: Ah... I'm done for... I can't fight like this.

104.1: I'm the girl who took a diet and became an aircraft carrier, Chitose. I even got faster. Maybe I should write a book about it.
104.25: Renovated from a seaplane carrier to a carrier, I'm Chitose. Slimming down my body by dieting. My legs even became faster. This will let me play a part in the Task Force! I'll do my best for you!
104.3: Isn't it great, this flightdeck? It's my favorite.
104.4: Admiral, I don't recall saying it was okay to touch.
104.29: There is no fleet action scheduled for a while. Before the next operation, I'm going to deal with many of trivial things that may bother you in the future. Admiral, drink sake if you like, and please make yourself at home. (Kai Ni)
104.28: The Admiral is always doing his utmost best. It's okay. I understand.
104.24: Thank you for always looking out for the reborn Chitose, Admiral.
104.9: I wonder if Chiyoda has gotten stronger.
104.10: No way, I might actually be cool.
104.12: Man, that's gonna leave a mark... Chiyoda will worry, so let's keep it a secret, yeah?
104.6: Repairs are over, the cans are over there. (Kai Ni)
104.5: A new ship has been completed.
104.7: The fleet has returned to the home port.
104.16: Fellow planes, go get 'em! /or/ First attack wave, take off!
104.23: Chiyoda's gonna yell "Don't get too cocky" at me, so let's keep quiet about this.
104.20: I won't let you hit my flight deck!
104.21: Ah man, my precious flight deck...
104.22: Chiyoda... I leave the rest... to you...
104.30: 12 midnight. Together with the Admiral, I watched the day tick over! *giggle*
104.31: It's 1 A.M. Ah, somehow I'm uneasy... perhaps Chiyoda is mad?
104.32: It's 2 A.M. Being the timekeeper, it's a bit rough, you know...
104.33: It's 3 A.M. Just as a nightcap, would you like something to drink?
104.34: 4 A.M. I wonder if Chiyoda is sleeping well...
104.35: 5 A.M. Admiral, the daily quests have renewed. Let's clear them out together!
104.36: zzz... haa... Ah! 6 A.M. Admiral! Sorry! I borrowed your lap for a bit.
104.37: 7 A.M. Daybreak sure is refreshing. Good morning.
104.38: It's 8 A.M. Thanks to the Admiral, I was able to sleep well last night.
104.39: 9 A.M. For me, it's too early to be drinking or to be sober. *giggle*
104.40: 10 A.M. Today's maneuvers, what are you considering?
104.41: 11 A.M. For lunch, what do you want to do?
104.42: 12 midday, it's lunch time, no? On a hill overlooking the port, even a bento is great!
104.43: It's 1 P.M. With the Admiral, even a convenience bento is great. *giggle* How lovely!
104.44: It's 2 P.M. Ah.. Admiral, I see Chiyoda over there! He~y Chiyoda~?
104.45: It's 3 P.M. Oh my? Chiyoda, she ran away all angry. I wonder why~?
104.46: It's 4 P.M. Admiral, this evening's maneuvers, what are you considering?
104.47: 5 P.M. Such a beautiful twilight, isn't it?
104.49: 7 P.M. Just time for dinner, no? How about we go to Houshou's?
104.50: 8 P.M. Admiral, how about taking your time in a bath today?
104.51: 9 P.M. Admiral, the bath is.... going together is impossible!
104.52: 10 P.M. Oh my, what is it Chiyoda? It's all right, I'm not bothering the Admiral. Don't worry.
104.53: 11 P.M. Admiral, staying up late every day is bad. Go to bed early today...

105.1: The girl that became an aircraft carrier, Chiyoda. Of course, I'll be assigned to Chitose-onee's fleet, yes?

105.4: Chitose-onee, do that when we're alone in the room... Oh. It's you, Admiral?
105.29: Admiral, it's Chiyoda! Did you forget about me?
105.28: Even though I'm worried for just Chitose-onee, the Admiral upon that... really, good grief.
105.24: Admiral.... I'm happy that you have feeling for me, but still, I'm worried about Chitose-onee...
105.9: Thank you! With this, I can match the regular carriers, no?
105.10: Leyte will be okay this time!
105.11: Carrier maintenance is vital, you know.
105.12: Ow-w-w~ Keep this a secret... from Chitose-nee~
105.5: A new ship has been added to our fleet.
105.7: Operation's complete, the fleet has returned.
105.14: Aircraft carrier Chiyoda, launching! Attack wings are all ready, sortieing!
105.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Strike wing, commencing assault!
105.16: Right, bomber wing, attack wing, It's your turn!
105.18: It's about time for the coup-de-grace!

105.32: 2 A.M. Not sleeping? I wanna hurry up and go to Chitose-onee's room so go to sleep~
105.33: 3 A.M. To call on the Admiral hourly... seriously, what kind of mission is this?
105.34: 4 A.M.... I-I can't sleep now! I'm in the middle of a mission!

105.36: 6 A.M. About time for the town to wake up.
105.37: 7 A.M. Admiral, it's morning! Are you refreshed?
105.38: 8 A.M. You look busy. Job? Study? Manuscript? Anything's fine. Going off to sortie!
105.39: 9 A.M. I wonder what's Chitose-onee's doing around this time...
105.40: 10 A.M. Admiral, what do you think of Chitose-nee? You're gonna answer me in an hour!
105.41: 11 A.M. Sooooo, you like Onee, huh? E-eh!? N-No, you can't!
105.42: Midday.... hey, Admiral, until you take back what you said, today's lunch is on hold!
105.43: It's 1 P.M. Admiral, take it back! I'm getting hungry too~ hey~
105.44: 2 P.M. The Admiral's so stubborn~ You'll be my rival in love from today! Eh, it can't be helped. Here, onigiri.
105.45: It's 3 P.M. So, where are we attacking this afternoon? East? South?
105.46: 4 P.M. Not here... Chitose-nee's not here!
105.47: 5 P.M. Admiral~ What do you like about Sis? You're gonna answer me in an hour!
105.48: 6 P.M. So, what's your answer!　hmm... I see... hmmm... e-eh! N-No way!
105.49: 7 P.M. It's dinner time but.... Admiral... you go on ahead... I'm a little shocked... I lost my appetite...
105.50: It's 8 P.M. My eyes aren't red...because I've been crying!
105.51: It's 9 P.M. Admiral... giving me supper... I'm a little glad, maybe...
105.52: It's 10 P.M. As I thought, Chitose-Onee sleeping on the Admiral's lap, I can't forgive this!
105.53: 11 P.M! I'll refresh the memories of Onee! So, gimme that lap! Good night!

57.1: I'm torpedo cruiser Ooi. By the way, I wonder where Kitakami-san is.
57.25: It's Ooi, torpedo cruiser edition. My torpedo powers were counted in, but I didn't have much of the limelight. I'll show you what I'm made of this time. Keep your eyes open!
57.2: Is this some sort of drill?
57.3: Kitakami-san? Ah, Commander, what is the matter?
57.4: You like them too, Admiral? Yes, I have a lot attached to my legs! ...but you've touched them too much, so how about eating 20 of them?
57.29: Will Kitakami-san be alright?..... I'm getting worried as I'm not with her... Hmm... I'm so worried... It's definitely, yes, there's definitely something that's about to happen! I have to go now!
57.28: Admiral? What happened to the other girls, you say? Eh...? That's not it? Hmm, it's okay then.. It's okay...
57.24: Of the two Torpedo cruisers, you chose me, right?... If you betray me, I'll sink you in the ocean, you know...
57.8: It seems there is a message for you, Admiral.
57.9: These Type-93 Oxygen Torpedoes are so cool... and marvelous.
57.10: I want to be able use my torpedoes to their maximum abilities.
57.26: If Kitakami is fine with it, go ahead.
57.27: Yep, be sure to pack me with fuel and torpedoes okay? Fufu, this way I can fight again.
57.11: Yes, I'll be taking a short break.
57.12: That strategy was horrible... No, sorry for my incompetence.
57.6: That's right, a ship is fully repaired.
57.5: A new friend has joined our fleet.
57.7: The campaign has ended. Good work.
57.14: Now, let's go and fire these oxygen torpedoes up!
57.18: Who's the one that hurt Kitakami?
57.23: I'm the one? Aww, I'm loss for words♪ Eh, Kitakami-san...? Did Kitakami-san see that!? Did she!?
57.21: Oh no! My torpedo tubes are in tatters now!
57.22: I guess it isn't bad... to sink as a Torpedo Cruiser...
57.30: Admiral, midnight has just came around again. It's late night.
57.31: The time is currently at 0100. Eh...? It sounds too strict? I-I see...
57.32: The time is――... Ah, I mean, it's 0200. Do you prefer it like this, Admiral?
57.33: 0300. ...Geez, so annoying. Being picky even in the way I make the hourly announcements... N-Nothing! It's 0300, sir!
57.34: It's 04...00... Admiral? Admiral...? Did he go to sleep? ...THIS IS MY CHANCE!
57.35: 0500. I need to go to Kitakami-san's side!! Yes, she is definitely troubled! Kitakami-saaaaaaaaaan!!
57.36: 0600! Kitakami-san, are you okay, are you safe!? I-it looks like you're fine... Eh? This knife? Ah, it's for making breakfast...
57.37: 07,00... Yes, I was thinking, of preparing, breakfast... For today's miso soup, are you okay with gluten?
57.38: 0800. Alright, for Kitakami-san's sake, I made breakfast with a quality that is above my skill level! Please go ahead and eat up♪ ...It's delicious? I'm relieved♪
57.39: 0900. Eh, shouldn't I return to my post? But...
57.40: 1000. Admiral, I'm back... Where did I go? ...Isn't it obvious, of course it's to Kitakami-san's place!!
57.41: 1100. Um... Admiral? Why are you holding your head like that? Did you get a flu!? Let's see, where is the flu medicine...
57.42: It's 1200. It is now noon. Should I make some lunch? It's fine. I'm good at cooking.
57.43: 1300. Go on, eat up! Eh? What is this...? It's obviously omelette rice! Should I write something with the ketchup?
57.44: It's 1400. What is it, Admiral? What's with that look of doubt on your face. I didn't do anything like poison your lunch, you know? How rude.
57.45: 1500. It's about time to seriously go out for some sorties now I guess. ..Yes, I'll do my best!
57.46: 1600. Um... For the expedition, what should the fleet do, Admiral?
57.47: It's 1700. Oh my, It's nearly dinner time. I'll prepare dinner food for a while.
57.48: The time is currently at 1800. What kind of pot is this, you ask? It's certainly, my special curry, fulfilled with my love! I'm leaving!
57.49: 1900. Kitakami-san♪ I just accidentally cook too much curry! If you don't mind, let's eat togetheeeeR!
57.50: 2000. See, there's a curry for Admiral too. Eh? It's delicious...? Your body is getting hotter? You see?
57.51: It is now 2100. Let's see, we're done washing up, the area around the fire is okay too. Good work for today, Admiral. Fuu...
57.52: 2200. Tsk, That one light cruiser is making such a noise A―GAIN... Admiral, Can I go to complain her? Ah, O...Okay?
57.53: 2300. Admiral, Thank you for your hard work today. Is Kitakami-san already sleeping?

58.1: A brand new Kitakami... that's me, all right. I feel a lot more grown up, loaded to the brim with oxygen torpedoes.
58.25: It's Super Kitakami-sama, equipped with type-93 oxygenated torpedos, with 20 firing tubes on each side. It's been said that I have overpowering strength, but I did not really get any chances to shine. Bah.
58.2: These Type-93 oxygen torpedoes sure are heavy...
58.3: Nuh... What, Admiral...? What is it with you? I don't mind it, though.
58.4: T-that? I'd rather not load any...
58.29: You know... My shoulder is getting all stiff. Even though I'm still too young for this~. Torpedoes really are kinda heavy, aren't they?
58.28: Admiral? What's up? Feeling down? That's not like you, it's all good.
58.24: Admiral, I got a bit of a request... that weapon, I don't really want it, yeah?... I'm countin' on ya!
58.8: A message for you, Admiral. Here.
58.9: Keep em' coming! I'll become an even better ship.
58.11: Yeah... 'tis a difficult ship, ain't it.
58.12: Yeah... sure is a difficult one. I'll go get fixed in the meanwhile.
58.6: Repair is done. How bout you take a look.
58.5: A new ship has been floated.
58.7: Oh, seems like the fleet returned.
58.14: Well, I make the ultimate combination with Ooi.
58.15: 20 shots of Oxygen Torpedoes, going in twice.
58.16: My 40 firing tubes ain't just for show, 'ya know.
58.18: Time to make oil soup out of you!
58.17: Well, my main cannons are... well... yeah...
58.23: Hehe, so this is the power of a torpedo ship. Man... I'm glad I got to do something.
58.19: Guh... I really have no defensive powers...
58.21: Well, how should I say this... I guess these things happen. I wanna get fixed!
58.22: I'd like to be a battleship in my next life after all... gulp
58.31: 0100. Yes, that's right. It's the time keeping thing. I'll be doing it for today.
58.32: 0200. I'm gettin' bored of it-. Don't you have things like manga? No manga? ...tch.
58.33: 0300. It's completely late into the night now. I'm sleepy too...
58.34: It's now 0400. Aren't you sleepy, Admiral? I see, isn't that nice...
58.35: 0500. It turned into morning now... It's so bright-... I'm sho sleepy, can I sleep? Starting from right now...
58.36: 0600. Wah! What's wrong, Ooichi? Why're you makin' such a scary face? What's wrong? What's up?
58.37: 0700. Admiral, Ooichi made breakfast. Eh? It's fine, I'm thankful for it.
58.38: 0800. The breakfast that Ooichi made, time to eat! ...Hmm, why is there only portions for two? What about Admiral's?
58.39: 0900. So I keep saying, I'm fine, Ooichi. Go on, go back to your post~. Yes, yes.
58.40: 1000. Fuu... Ooichi has finally gone back. No, she's a good girl, really. Ah, you already knew that? Is that so.
58.41: 1100. After doin' the things on hand, it's already noon huh. Hmm, what should I eat for lunch? Ah, there's still work to do? Right right.
58.42: 1200. It's lunch tiime-! So, what should I eat today? Hmm.
58.43: 1300. That's right, as expected, it's got to be curry for lunch~! Should I go for Mamiya curry? Or should I just take a rest?
58.44: Fuu, in the end, it's always Mamiya-san's curry. Well, that's fine too. It's delicious after all. Ah, it's 1400. Just for the record.
58.45: 1500. Well. Lot'sa things happened. But y'know, that also can't be helped. Is what I'm thinking now.
58.46: 1600. Ah, it's Abukuma. O~i! Hmm? Why did she run away? O~i. ...What a weird person, right?
58.47: It's now 1700. Almost time to finish for the day~ The sun's heading down~
58.48: 1800. Well, 'bout time we close up, yeah? Oh, still too early? I see... tch.
58.49: 1900. Ah, Ooichiii! Why'ya holding a pot? Eh? Ooichi's deluxe curry? C-Curry is it...
58.50: 2000. Hey, Admiral, it is okay to have curry again for dinner? Hmmm. It's pretty good, I'm gettin' chills! Ooicchi, thanks♪
58.51: 2100. Well, we ended up having nothing but curry today, but Ooichi's sure is delicious, yeah? The flavor's a bit strange, though.
58.52: 2200. Well, it's about time for the fleet missions to end for today, yeah? Good work everyone~. Time to sleep, time to sleep. Bye Admiral.
58.53: 2300. ...mm? Mmm~? Ehh.. I'm on night duty today? Eh~? Can I pull it off, doesn't it seem kinda impossible?
